reviewDescription: I needed a second TV for my living room and I wanted one around 40 inches. This TV is excellent! This TV is full HD, not LED. LED TVs show the picture on the screen the same from any angle. HD tv's tend to fade the picture on the screen as you watch it from other angles. So when I start to walk away from the TV and look back at the picture, it looks almost whited out. But sitting right in front of it, it's excellent picture and sound quality. Plus it's Samsung! I highly recommend this TV!
Bought this as a gift to my Grandson & He loves it for his room.Works great ,good picture & sound

This is the best TV I have ever owned. I can add all my streaming services to it without having to buy a fire stick, it comes with a ton of free channels, the color and picture are very clear and the price was extremely fair. Highly recommend

I bought this as a computer monitor for my Windows 10 PC and the image is excellent!  However, here is a longer-than-necessary note about a BIG negative experience I initially had, thinking (mistakenly) that it was the fault of this TV.  Several days ago I was shocked to discover that whenever a typical alert happened on the computer such as "printer out of paper," etc., there wasn't just a little chime that emanated from the TV, but an ear-splitting blast of sound!  I've never experienced this before.  My ears actually hurt from the sound blast.  Looking for a solution online, my search brought up the "best" suggestion which was to go to Settings > Sound > Expert Settings > Sound Feedback > OFF.  But... that did NOT shut it off.  Then, when I hit the MUTE button to temporarily eliminate the problem, there was an annoying SPEAKER SLASH icon that continual flashed on the screen.  Now, here comes my confession of folly, my big "duh moment."  I finally checked the settings on my faithful PC and realized that, for some reason, my PC's audio setting had jumped to 100%.  I'm so glad I checked this because it had never been a problem with my previous monitor -- a 70" Vizio that had to be replaced because of dying pixels that were creating large dark shadows.  SO... after adjusting the PC's audio settings, all is now PERFECT.  It's odd because I never tampered with the PC's audio settings.  Therefore, if you have this same problem of ear-splitting noise explosions erupting from your Samsung TV, maybe this story will provide your solution.

reviewTitle: I would definitely buy it again!
reviewDescription: Great quality❤️
Good price for a spare room tv. WiFi works great and simple to set up.
A picture is beautiful, the size, perfect and easy to understand all features with a little practice

reviewTitle: Extremely pleased with my new Samsung TV .
reviewDescription: Good choice on my purchase. I Love my new Samsung TV and extremely pleased with the services received from Amazon.

We bought this to replace an identical set that was damaged by our cat :-(  As it was advertised as a used (display) item missing the feet, I figured since it was the same model as our recently damaged set, I could just remove the feet from the old set and affix them to this one, and yes, that worked!  We also drilled a hole through one of the plastic feet and put a screw through it into the cheap table we use as a stand so it can't be knocked over again.  PURRRRFECT!!!
Entire screen was cracked upon arrival
Picture is clean and clear. Sound is good. Setup was easy. Only 2 HDMI was a drawback, needed to purchase an RCA adapter.

reviewTitle: This is a newer model smart TV
reviewDescription: I replaced a complete voice control Insignia TV with this Samsung TV.  I have to say that although the voice control did work on the other tv, it sometimes took two or three tries to get it to do what I wanted or to tune to the station I wanted.  This particular TV has numbers on the remote which at this point in time is still easier than voice control.  The picture is 1080p and is sharp and clear.  I only use it sometimes and so far it defaults to Samsung TV channels when you turn it on.  Would rather have it default to my cable channel connection and channels. Oh well, maybe I will have to read the manual.  Most of the Samsung TVs you see for sale are an older model from 2018.  This is newer and smarter.

I replaced my old Samsung with this smart tv. The picture and sound are very good. The only problem I had was trying to get tech support. Somehow, when trying to register it, I pressed something wrong and my account went to a European country that put my first name and a random last name associated with my USA email address. Then I tried to fix it and got locked out. After 3 texts to support in which they said the wait time was 3 1/2 hours because there were 514 customers ahead of me. After 5 hours, I gave up. The next day I waited hours again and support said they cannot handle anything in Europe. When I texted Europe, they never responded. So I contacted USA again and was told to call my cable provider. To register a Samsung product??!!??The problem with this is that I bought an extended warranty which is probably worthless without a registration.

We have several Samsung tv's, and are happy with all of them.  This was the cheapest one we've every bought, and we can tell the difference.  It takes a second or 2 when you choose menu items or change channels, I presume from a lesser processor.  The sleep control is buried in menus, a nuisance since this is in our bedroom.  I had to go to the hardware store to buy screws for the wall mount bracket, typical.  The cord is only 4' long.  I had to go buy a short extension cord.  That's getting pretty chintzy, even for an entry model.  And more important, the cord does not plug in well.  We had trouble setting up the tv until we realized the cord was not making a good connection.  We had to tape it in place where it plugs into the back of the tv.  I don't think that's a common problem though, I didn't see it in any other reviews.
I have this TV in my office. Perfect size and the quality is just fine for my office needs.
The quality of the picture is nice set up was easy
Tv is not 40" as it says on box. It is 42" and does not fit in cabinet
I like the quality but the size isn't as describedTape measure says 3ft

The picture quality is excellent. Navigating using the remote needs improvement. The tv has slow response time and the remote is small. If your fingers don't move as quickly as they once did this can be a problem. It is not the most user friendly tv I have owned and am still learning about all the features. For a low priced tv it is a good deal. Adding the DVD player was easy. I don't have all the channels that were on the old Samsung but it comes with a built in menu guide with many channels. Directions that came with it were very basic.
Very good

If I had known what I know now when I first purchased this TV, I would have slapped myself silly.I don't like this TV at all. There are too many buttons on the remote which means you accidentally hit what you don't want instead of what you do wish to have. The TV itself it has limited customizable ability. While you do get some free TV channels through the Samsung TV plus option and they're on the guide you can unselect / delete channels of stuff you've never going to watch. I don't speak spanish, I won't be watching any of the Spanish speaking channels for example.I strongly dislike the fact that I am stuck with apps for channels that I will never watch, that I will never pay for. I cannot delete these, as they are "basic default apps / channels". This is my TV I should be able to control what is on it. I've had other smart TVs, different brands allow me to customize 100%. This option is a joke. Also in the advertisements when I purchase the TV, it advertised that I can speak commands into my remote to do things such as change channel, volume, etc. B*******! One of the selling points that I was interested in reasons I bought this particular TV was for that option. It does not exist! They make you sign up for a Samsung account, nothing new there, everybody's got to know your business.But it does nothing! Nothing!! All it does is allow you to log in on the stupid TV. This is a joke, $250 f****** joke! I have never in my life wanted to drop kick a TV brand new out of the box so freaking bad as I want to with this one. I hate this TV! I hate the remote that came with it. I don't need 50, 000 buttons on a remote!Navigating features on this TV, like getting to settings or to the app section is a royal headache. Samsung needs to take this TV and put it where the sun don't shine. What a rip off!

reviewTitle: Go Bigger for a Better Set
reviewDescription: All about this tv was OK until we tried to connect to streaming. Its memory was  limited and extremly slow to load. For non-streaming, seems to be an ok "second"  set .For a primary, we had to go bigger to a Samsung  43-inch which works great. Also the legs were flimsy and holes were hard to match to attach them. Picture and sound were good, but not so much otherwise;

** Buyer Beware ** Update: 10/2023 I am still have connectivity issues. Everything is correct and the tv will just not connect. Eventually, days later, sometimes a week it will start working again only to disconnect randomly and start its BS again.—Four months from date of purchase and I have already had multiple issues with wi-fi connection. I have ZERO issues with any of my other devices including another older model of this same tv. It will be connected and then just disconnect and not reconnect no matter how I trouble shoot. Of course I am past the return window.Buyer beware.

reviewTitle: DIFFICULT TO SET UP, DIFFICULT TO CONTROL
reviewDescription: This is the least satisfying purchase I've made on Amazon since its inception. I purchased it because of the large number of 5-star reviews. Frankly, I don't get it. The TV arrived with the wrong remote, was difficult to set up, and is the least manageable TV I've ever owned. Its search capability gets a big fat F. When you do bring up a few options, you have less than 3 seconds to make a choice before all the options vanish from the screen. The remote is ridiculously complicated and hard to use. Most remotes have a single marked button for PAUSE (click it once to pause and a second time to un-pause). This remote require the use of 2 keys to do the same job. I could go on and on about the endless problems with this TV. The first week I had it I had to spend $130 on technicians to come out and resolve issues. Despite all the positive reviews I would NOT recommend this TV.

I bought this TV because I like my Samsung phone and with my LG flat screen TV I am able to screencast straight from my phone onto my LG TV with no hot stick no fire stick or anything else just the phone and the TV I thought for sure that a Samsung TV would have the same feature since it was a Samsung phone I was working from but this new TV does not even have that feature also they don't tell you in the reviews this TV is several years old and is mediocre picture best, disappointed and would probably not buy again

This tv is 29” wide and 17” in length but advertised as a 32” television. Diagonally it is 31.5”. I bought this because it is to fit in a specific place in the RV that is made for a television. This is even too small for the RV.

The tv did work for rlrvrn month, later failed. I did call warranty and was advised to do several adjustments and connections. None worked after several trials. Samsung advised me to ship the tv to them and pay return shipping cost, if fixed. An alternative was to buy much more expensive replacement ( about $600) with 20% "reduction" . So much for the "warranty" -- do not believe in promise. The additional warranty did not apply since the failure did happen before one year anniversary!

Price was right but still experimenting with picture quality options to possibly enhance the color richness of the picture.  It, so far, washes people's skin tone out to a bleached, pale white appearance.There are 4 picture quality options, but none have remedied the problem.

reviewTitle: The feet are terrible, the picture too.
reviewDescription: The little feet are very hard to install because you hade to blindly drop the screw into hollow bottom of foot. Then, no matter how hard or continuous you screw, they never tighten up. I have put together many things and these were useless. They spray out too so not great w limited space.  BUT, the WORST part was the picture. I did not expect a lower end TV to have OLED appearance, but the lack of clarity and using any of picture types (there are three) was astoundingly bad! The old Samsung we were replacing had WAY more brightness and clarity. No matter what we tried in balancing it out with all the other adjustments it had did nothing. It is a terrible TV. We only got it thinking a bigger screen that had more state of the art features would be nice for our mom. Forget this TV. It is worse than ancient ones. Like 70s.

reviewTitle: SOUND SOMETIMES BLASTS & REMOTE IS TOO SENSITIVE
reviewDescription: This replaced a Samsung I had and loved for several years. Unfortunately, the newer version occasionally blasts the sound when I turn it on. Not good in an apartment building. I have to unplug the TV for a minute or two and plug it back in. The remote is way too sensitive, and will sometimes jump many channels when I only want to go one or two. Too late to send the TV and remote back. Purchased in May 2023; replacing it December 1, 2023.

Setup for this TV is an unbelievable pain. It's a TV. Why complicate a simple device? Every time I turn on the TV, I get Gorden Ramsay and kitchen nightmares. Why? It is not desired by me. Other TVs present a menu. This does not. Starts a show running and takes a long to to stop it. When it does stop, I'm in slow motion Samsung TV streaming. I'm missing the old tube TVs. Once on, they worked without a myriad of issues.The remote's buttons are small. It reacts slowly to input. Pressing a button on the remote often cause double and triple input. Especially noticeable when scrolling. I can't tell if the remote recognize the button I pushed or not which creates problems not expect with a TV set. In short, I hate everything about this TV.

reviewTitle: It was a nightmare or so it seemed !
reviewDescription: I gave it three  because the Samsung setup drove me nuts. Why do I need an account with Samsung?It started off OK but slowly turned into frustration. I plugged in the Name and Password for mi internet Wi-Fi and it started downloading something. In a few minutes  I thought it was finished downloading  what it needed  and s I started filling in the prompts .It was weird sometimes  I would have to retype for some reason or other but eventually  I thought I was done . But no  Samsung wanted me to go to some website and prove I was a real person I guess. The link they gave me didn't work so I tried  a few different web browsers thinking maybe my favorite browsers  were the problem. That wasn't the problem. It turned out the link the gave me had a few extra characters. Once I removed them I was able to get to the website.  At the website they asked me for an email  and they sent me a code . and I had to type them  in my TV.Well I never  ever got a Samsung code I kept asking for new codes never received one.  After all that my wife all of sudden said  ""I got a picture""  Things got a little bit better after that.My wife and I spent  a good three hours with the TV just to get our cable channels  This is my third 32 inch Samsung  TV The first two were fine this one was a hair puller. .I was  just about ready to return it when TV started working.  I never did finish setting up that Samsung account but the TV is working fine. I don't know for sure but I think I after connecting to the internet and let Samsung just download  the updates or whatever I think the setup would have gone a lot easier.

Typical Samsung, they want you to give up all control to them in order for you to have a smart tv.  Really bad.  I cannot obtain apps for PBS Passport or Britbox without agreeing so I do not have any additional apps that did not come bundled like Netflix and Prime.  My Amazon Fire Insignia, owned by Bestbuy stopped captioning after 13 months so I tried this Samsung.  I require captioning for my deafness, so it is a big deal.Stuck with sucker.  I had to add a optical converter to be able to use headphones, since this model does not have a headphone jack, but it does have an optical jack.  Overall, not happy with unit.

This tv does not have the standard Samsung remote.It is a worse remote than the hotels I stay at when I travel for work.My biggest complaint is you have to press 11  buttons to set it to turn off after you fall asleep.It is quite the sequence and the surrounding buttons are sensitive and commonly get pushed during the process.

reviewTitle: Resolution - Bluetooth Not Showing Up & WIFI Not Working/WIFI Cutting In And Out
reviewDescription: Resolution - Bluetooth Not Showing Up & WIFI Not Working/WIFI Cutting In And Out:After updating software, resetting the tv, network settings, and infinity router more than 10 times each, trying to get this to work, and doing other things, like unplugging power for 60 seconds, and holding power button down at the tv, and NOTHING WORKED! I found an amazon review, that talked about how these tvs have issues because they were programmed or whatever in another country...They said the factory reset worked for them, but it didn't for me. I'd seen other people talk about resetting the tv through a special hidden service menu, and I did that many times as well, but nothing worked. Anyway, while looking at the special service menu, I thought I would try something, to see if I can get this tv “unstuck” from whatever country it was programmed in... I did the following steps.***For bluetooth issues, you can follow steps below, and under MRT OPTION, you will see BT SUPPORT, select it, and set this to ON, and you should see bluetooth speaker list show up under sound settings***-Turned off tv-Then push Mute, then press 1, then press 8, then press 2 on the remote (make sure the red power light at the bottom of tv blinks each time you push each button, so you know it is taking input)-Then I powered on tv-It takes more than a few seconds for the special menu to pop up, and lets you select entries (see screenshots to see what service menu looks like and setting changes I made)-I selected OPTION, then went down to MRT OPTION, then selected Region, and changed it to KOR (all this will be done with the arrow buttons on remote, the middle button and return button)-Also, under MRT OPTION, I went to NETWORK SUPPORT, and set it to wifi_int_only (I don’t know if this helped but I figured if I set to wifi only, that it might also help get it “unstuck”)-I powered off tv, and then back on and checked wifi settings, and of course it wouldn’t pickup anything because it was set to wrong REGION-I powered off tv, and pressed the MUTE, 1, 8, 2-Went back in and changed REGION back to USA and NETWORK SUPPORT back to wifi_int-I powered off tv and back on, and mine picked up my wifi right away; if yours doesn’t just go in and set to wifi and all should work***BTW, If you are like me, and turn off your wifi router at night, make sure to turn it on and let it get its connection, before turning on tv, or else, you may have to go through steps above again, setting region to kor, etc! It's happened to me twice, so i just turn on router, let it get its connection and then tv works smoothly***

reviewTitle: Good picture but lacks enough hdmi ports
reviewDescription: The TV is good: it has a good picture quality and adequate sound.  I gave it three stars for two reasons: the feet need to be either heavier or wider for better stability and the unit lacks enough HDMI ports.  I have a VCR and cable receiver box that are plugged in but I need another port for the sound bar.  There is room; not sure why it did not include three ports.

reviewTitle: Not intuitive, not good for cable
reviewDescription: Too difficult to find and keep setting for cable TV. Would like easier language choice, want English not Spanish. How to find selection button. No voice control in remote. Now using two remotes-one for TV one for cable.

This TV is good for the price .  The picture quality is very good, not great, but definitely acceptable for the price point.  The Audio is clean also, I use a sound bar, but it is nice to have decent audio within a TV this small. If not for the imposition of Samsung to force the "smart" features upon me, I would have given it another star.My biggest complaint about this TV is getting through the setup.  I don't want yet another smart phone app nor do I want the packaged SAMSUNG bloatware.  I use the TV with a ROKU, I wanted to hook it up to HDMI and be done with it.  I don't want yet another interface or any of the SAMSUNG Apps and I wasted 30 minutes figuring out how to bypass all that.It comes with Smart Hub defaulted to on but it is not obvious.  So every time you start it it asks you to agree to terms and conditions even if you disable the network by skipping past that.  It really tries to get you to connect to the internet.  Seems to be pretty "smart" when it makes business sense but not so much for the user.  A TV should first be a TV, if people want the "smart" features, they should be given a choice to setup that way.I do like that the remote has a source selection button.  Once you get past all the setup inconvenience and you disable smart hub from starting each time, you can use it as a TV and quickly switch between input sources .  Newer versions of SAMSUNG and other TVs make you go to the menu to select your source which takes too much time.I don't know why SAMSUNG (and others) offer an abundance of streaming channels with poor content.  I don't see this as profitable nor useful.  As a user I want to quickly find quality content.  I think manufacturers should package ROKU or Fire Stick and standardize content management vs. inventing their own.  I believe it would save on overall cost and simplify navigation for users.  Numerous content managers is adding too much complexity and I think this is a case where open competition is adding to overall cost and decreasing efficiency.

reviewTitle: VESA screws are M8 and 20-21mm long; UPDATE: NO SLEEP BUTTON ON REMOTE!
reviewDescription: UPDATE: Everything seemed fine until I went to settle down for the night and discovered that there's NO SLEEP BUTTON ON THE REMOTE for this Samsung 43" TV! I think they're giving up space for useless app buttons that would be much better served with a sleep button. Downgraded rating to a 3 because of this one thing. The sleep function is buried waaay into the menu, and when you're drowsy and want to re-set it, you'd have to wake fully in order to get through the menu. Very, very bad design. Sadly, it seems that most of the manufacturers of 43" TVs (I don't know about larger ones) have abandoned the sleep button, so I haven't been able to find any alternatives. Fortunately, I saved the remote from my old Samsung TV which DID have a sleep button, and it works--not as nicely as it did with the older TV--but it does at least get you down to the sleep function of the TV without having to drill down through the menu. The Samsung Store on Amazon has a universal Samsung remote that's supposed to have a sleep button on it (the picture doesn't show one). So I ordered it and we'll see if it has the sleep button and if it works with this new TV. Very disappointed that this one item could downgrade an otherwise great TV.-----------------------------------We purchased a swivel table mount for this TV, and the VESA screw holes are really big--so much so that the table mount didn't come with screws that large. Picked some up from the hardware store, but couldn't use any washers because no washer will go around the screw and still fit in the hole on the back of the TV. It's not a deal-breaker, but I'd have preferred to put the washers as well.As far as performance, I've been buying Samsung TVs for years and have always been pleased. I expect to be the same with this one.

reviewTitle: Great picture. Poor design on stabilizers that hold the TV up
reviewDescription: Great picture. Fair sound quality.  The cheap plastic feet were difficult to attach. The tiny screws through  a long slot. One side could not be secured tight enough  to hold the TV. The TV is now held up by books!!

Have been using it for only 2 days and it's working fine. I very much liked that Samsung has free customer service to help me get started. I didn't understand what to do to get the TV running, but they helped step by step. And when I called, the wait time to get help was not long! Because of the good reputation of Samsung and their great service, I will buy Samsung again!

When my TV provider wanted to increase my already high monthly bill ($249) by $20, I decided to cut the cable. But, I needed to buy a couple smart TV's that have internet connectivity. These Samsungs are great for the bedrooms. Excellent picture and they will pay for themselves quickly, because my streaming bill is $118 / month. Very impressive quality and features for under $200.

I need to mention the first time we got it, I can only assume some clown tried to steal the new TV we ordered and gave us a completely broken, used, different (smaller) sized TV in a box advertising what we ordered. But the box even looked worn. And even the parts, like the legs you have to screw on were all different.Thankfully we have good experiences with Amazon customer service. So aside from that experience and upon receiving the true Samsung 40 in, I *really* like it. I have always been a 100% LGTV buyer. And maybe all brands have this feature now, and I’m behind, but they have this Samsung TV Plus feature and it’s like free built-in cable. But it’s not regular cable, which to me is the worst. It’s very nuanced channels, like one channel seems to just play old Baywatch episodes. There’s a Bob Ross channel. They have 3-5 crime channels, and they play the best of true crime from 80s- early 2000s, such as Forensic Files, the original Unsolved Mysteries, The New Detectives. The commercials are quick or there is just silence with a “we’ll be right back” image. This is so up my alley. I hope it always has this feature.Also it’s easy to connect to all your other streaming accounts
nice tv
This is easily the best smart tv on the market
Quick delivery, excellent picture.  Highly recommend.
whether it's buying, canceling, returning, or service, you can't do better than Amazon.Amazon should change its name to AMAZING
Love this tv- picture quality and the free Samsung tv channels are good. Just wish it had msnbc channel.
Works great as advertised! Recommended
I needed a new TV because my old one didn't have streaming capability. It's very nice and has a great picture. I can stream all I want.
I'm using this unit as a monitor for my PC ... overall pleased with the results!
The only thing is no sleeep timer, other than that best set I have had.

reviewDescription: Samsung delivers on a bedroom or office smart tv for a great price.
Good picture quality
Used in a guest room. Has a good picture.
The sound and picture quality is great.  Samsung makes a great TV.

reviewTitle: Excellent Picture Quality - SMART TV Connects to WIFI Internet
reviewDescription: Was concerned about obtaining a sufficient Internet connection. After plugging in a WIFI extender in the room, SMART TV work very well.
Good television simple good price
Beautiful,bright picture.

reviewTitle: Not happy , pitcher is good  , now tv  goes black screen?
reviewDescription: It’s a nice little TV lightweight which is really good because I fractured my back and it’s movable easily except the HDM and other slots to put other components on there are only two ports. The reviews on the control part was that most everyone did not like the controls. I kind of agree.
Like it the only thing it’s to sensitive the on  off buttons it shut off continuously even if you barely touch it

reviewTitle: Great Picture, Terrible Sound Quality, Poor Quality Stand/Feet
reviewDescription: The picture quality is wonderful, and it has perfect color balance without having to adjust it yourself. Setup is a breeze as it does everything for you. Remote works well. The price is a bargain and it arrived early and in perfect condition.The drawbacks:Imagine the sound of grandma's old single speaker 1950s tabletop radio she kept in the kitchen. This TV sounds similar, but not as good. It's tinny and weak, even at full volume. We tried all the fixes and none of them worked. I enjoy the nostalgia of vintage electronics, but not in a brand new TV. Solution: We will purchase a sound bar or speakers for it. Second problem is with the stand/feet. They're made of flimsy plastic and poorly designed so that every time you so much as breath near the TV it pitches forward. Solution: For a temporary fix we duct taped the feet down to the console table until we can order a stand for it.If you're going to buy one of these, order a stand and the sound bar or speakers at the same time. At this price, it will still be a bargain.

reviewTitle: About as good as it gets.
reviewDescription: The sound is a bit quirky. LOUD sometime on power up.

reviewTitle: Good solid TV with lots of features!
reviewDescription: Solid Samsung TV with plenty of smart features. Have been able to connect my PC / Mac and phone to it for streaming. Already has the important apps like Netflix, Apple TV, Hulu, Alexa.. was really easy to connect and go with it.

reviewTitle: Update;Old Samsung problem Wi-Fi won’t stay connected or hangs
reviewDescription: I have to update my review on this TV. I had to literally unplug it several times because I kept losing the Wi-Fi but for some reason it just stopped happening. And it was not my Wi-Fi because I would always verify it was not my router that went down. I am Not a technical neophyte. 😁This is the second Samsung TV that I have bought that has a Wi-Fi problem. Do not buy Samsung smart TVs if you wish to use the Internet Wi-Fi. And of course now that I’ve noticed it it’s past 30 days to return .Update: I spoke to Samsung customer support and he asked me to do a soft reset of the TV. By that he meant for me to leave the TV on and unplug it and leave it unplugged for 30 seconds. I did so by unplugging the plug from the TV itself, waited 30 seconds and plugged it back in. My apps that were hanging are no longer hanging. I will see if this happens again. If I have to do this very often I will be calling them back.

reviewTitle: Nice clear and bright picture, but I had a few niggles with the settings.
reviewDescription: This tv has a good quality picture if you are looking for full HD.  I was glad to find it because I don't like the look of 4K tv pictures.  Too much detail doesn't leave enough to the imagination and makes everything look fake somehow.My problem with this tv was there wasn't any setting for changing the resolution down or up. And the output to a sound bar disable the TV;s sound control.  I had to use the sound bar control to change the volume.Maybe a better quality sound bar would link up to it better, but the one I bought with it had to be returned because it only worked for about 10 minutes.  It was another Samsung product that sounded great for 10 minutes, but then refused to power back on.  Maybe it got dropped in the mail and something came loose inside.The viewing angel on the tv is good and the tv itself has pretty good sound, but lacked bass.  That is why I bought a sound bar, because it had a remote wireless subwoofer.  But that didn't work out.

This pretty much does everything I need it to do and it is the perfect size for my environment.  The only minor drawback: no Bluetooth or audio out.  So the built in speakers are the only way to listen to it.I use YouTube, Amazon Prime Video, Netflix, Apple TV, PLEX and the USB port on it.  I also use the wired Ethernet on it.I am extraordinarily happy with it.
Nice tv for a bedroom. Sound needs improvement.

reviewTitle: TV does a fine job, just don't be in a hurry to do it
reviewDescription: I've had many Samsung TVs and we bought this one for use as a lobby display. The only thing it needs to do is mirror a computer's screen for an ongoing, looping presentation. It took three firmware updates before the option to connect finally appeared, and since then it has worked normally. The screen quality is just fine for this use and we don't use any audio so I can't comment on that. The Smart Hub works well enough, but seriously, have a calming cup of tea with you while doing the setup. It is SOOOOO SLOOOOOOWWWW. Menus respond slowly, apps launch slowly, remote connections start slowly, etc. That said, it's a decent deal for the price, just remember to put in all available firmware updates to enable key features, and be patient with it.
Great picture fair sound not bluetooth compatible totally disappointed

Was initially hesitant about purchasing this tv because of all the negative reviews but have had two Samsung tv's and they have both been great.  The remote leaves a lot to be desired as the buttons are small and still haven't gotten used to it after 5 weeks. The apps are small and difficult to read. The picture is great now but took some time to get it right. The blacks were to dark and made the whole picture look dark. Almost sent the tv back because of this. The secrete turned out to be finding the control for adjusting the white balance, which wasn't listed with adjusting the brightness, contrast etc. You need to go to expert settings and scroll to white balance. Hope this review is helpful.

reviewTitle: Great TV Crippled by its Lack of Analog Sound Output Connector
reviewDescription: TV has a good, vibrant 1920x1080 display with no dead or off-color pixels. Other resolutions not tested.My only gripe is the lack of an audio-out that would allow us to control our external speakers and subwoofer via the TV's volume control. The manufacturer must surely know that this size TV is generally too small for modern living rooms, where digital-input audio equipment is most likely to be found. In our home, this TV is wall-mounted in the kitchen where there is no room for a digital-to-analog converter.I just never imagined that a TV without "speakers" connectors would be sold, so I didn't check for that before buying it. My bad. (I also have a new computer with no diskette or CD-RW/BluRay drive for exactly the same reason.)TL;DR: Buy this if the crappy internal speakers is OK with you. Otherwise, pick another TV.

The volume is erratic. Sometimes when first turned on the volume needs to be adjusted way above normal settings, and sometimes when turned on the volume is so loud I expect the speakers to 'blow!'I called for assistance and they just said to unplug for a few minutes. That worked, but did not solve the problem, lonhterm.
It is an older make smart TV...remote is abominable.  Control buttons are small, way too close to each other.Navigating through the TV menu is tedious to say the least.
Good TV , but no Bluetooth!

Bought this TV from Amazon in April 2022.  Died in February 2023.  It was made in Viet Nam in October 2021.  Samsung said it was out of warranty, and it would be cheaper to replace as opposed to repair..  Until it died it was a great TV.
I love this TV but disappointed in the TV’s feet. They are clearly not designed to be place a TV. I had to prior a book underneath to keep the TV a from falling forward.

The remote and the placement of certain buttons seems a little unnatural but overall it does what it needs to do. Occasionally I do find I have to press buttons more than once. If you're not easily annoyed it may not be too big of a deal. The TV I received actually is 36inches in total length (I had chosen 40in) which I found to be odd, but it was purchased to be used in my bedroom so the size is not a huge problem. I'm planning to buy a 50inch for the living room. Overall good quality. Good picture. It also dims into night mode if the lights in the room you're  in are dim or off so that's  a nice smart feature to have. Pleased with my purchase just surprised by the size I received. It's sitting on a stand that's about 59in.

I just threw out a Fire TV which was garbage from day 1 and Best Buy was no help at all in getting it fixed. This Samsung is doing a great job so far. It doesn't shut off after 15 minutes of viewing which is a huge plus when watching TV. The Fire TV shut down constantly no matter how many updates, and reboots I did.So if you like to watch TV for more than 15 minutes at a time, and you aren't looking for a lot of extra features, like Bluetooth, etc this TV is for you.

reviewTitle: Other brands are cheaper and eisier to use.
reviewDescription: Excellent sound and image but you can only control the tv thru the remote and it is very ackward, you hit just one wrong buttom and you lose everything you had being doing before; I would not recommend to others. The saler was excellent everything arrived fast and in perfect condition.

Bought this for aging  Mother-n-law who is somewhat hard-of-hearing!.Couldn't make it loud enough, even at max volume for her to hear it -Returned it for a lesser manufacturer brand who had more / great volume .

reviewTitle: Beware sound was fine and now is bad.
reviewDescription: What options are there for improving the sound, other than just replacing the tv itself?

reviewTitle: It's a Samsung Need I say more
reviewDescription: ok, I bought this tv some time ago and I had it on all night and it blew. It doesn't work anymore and I am so dissap[ointed that a Samsung broke so soon.

reviewTitle: Picture wasn’t as good as the same model I had 6 years prior
reviewDescription: Disappointed that the same model from 6 years earlier was a better picture than this newer model.

reviewTitle: Nit my best purchase on Amazon
reviewDescription: The picture quality is great! The on and off switch does not work 1/2 the time I need to unplug it to reset. Need to find out about warranty.
Recently started having an issue where I'll get the sound but no picture. Have to power cycle the unit to get a picture. Week past the return deadline means I'm stuck with it.
Just hate the remote… It has 1000 buttons and it doesn’t light up. Also having trouble getting the sound to go through my cable remote.
Horrible to set up
Terrible product!

reviewTitle: Every picture profile except movie (which looks good to me) is total crap and not enjoyable to watch
reviewDescription: I'm a truck driver so I have this up in my truck connected to my wifi Hotspot. Good picture, and I'm pretty picky about TVs. Vizio have crystal clear picture at this price range but Samsung has superior color in comparison. The picture only looks good on movie mode, it custom mode. Other than that though, it looks like total crap, like water color painting. Movie mode is very good though.
I have had several instances of volume control failure resulting in either very high blaring volume or very low volume audio.  I will be contacting the Samsung service center.
Poor sound quality and picture color controls are inadequate.

reviewTitle: Disappointed with Direct TV Now on this Samsung TV
reviewDescription: I purchased this Samsung TV because it lists built-in support for the "Direct TV Now" streaming app. I was expecting a more polished, seamless integration of streaming TV but discovered the app remains in beta on this Samsung device, and found it to be an inferior experience compared to "Direct TV Now" on an Apple TV. Specifically "Direct TV Now" was slow to load, slow operating, and the picture remained pixelated longer. Basic functions while operating the App do not intuitively correspond to the Samsung remote contributing to a confusing experience; pressing channel up/down doesn't work (you press left and right arrows instead to change channels); pressing Guide instantly exits the app and presents the Samsung guide.

Great little secondary TV. We got this for my daughter's room. She is not much of a TV watcher, but occasionally she likes watching YouTube videos or Netflix. I figured this would be a better alternative to her watching videos on her phone or laptop,

Be aware. This is a great deal on a TV, but it’s an older (2018) version and the software doesn’t support the xfinity streaming app.  You will still need a streaming device. Xfinity recommended Roku to me.

reviewTitle: Not the best Samsung TV I own... remote is overly complex and interface feels too complicated
reviewDescription: I bought this TV for my mom because the Samsung I have at home is simple and has a very straightforward interface and remote.  THIS Samsung has a much less intuitive remote control, and that makes the user experience a bit harder.  Good value, but I wish it had a better remote!

Picture, auto dimming feature & volume good. Used as a bedroom tv; after changing settings for menu screens to dark I decided to keep, otherwise way too bright for nighttime use. USB input was high on my required list, but it does not play AVI files, some MKV files have no sound. Biggest disappointment is the remote: select button not easily distinguishable via Braille, buttons small & abundant. Menu & navigation is easy to mess up requiring a do over. Menu screens require multi buttons to ‘exit’ after selection. Sleep timer needs a 90 minute option (30-60-120-180). Disappointed but competition for this size TV with same options is nil.

Speakers face backwards of course, so you want an external amplifier-speaker system.  This TV set is great in all respects except that it does not provide the demodulated audio  (typically pin jacks on the back panel) for that purpose.

The TV set up easily and quickly connected to my WiFi signal, but I find it very slow connecting to YouTube or YouTubeTV.  It streams slowly, thereby affecting the picture quality and causing frequent pauses.  I have two Sony tv’s which perform much better and have superior picture quality.  Samsung, I’m disappointed.

reviewTitle: Unless you have wifi, you don't have any smart features.
reviewDescription: I bought this for my camper so that I had seamless connectivity with my Samsung smart phone. When camping we have to rely on cell towers to watch the news and get email/internet There is no wifi when camping, non of the smart features I would have liked to have between the phone and the TV work. At least now I don't need any third party software to get the TV to go into screen mirroring instantly with the phone. That was 99% of what I was trying to achieve. The picture is poor. I bought a 32" Phillips TV from Wal Mart for much less and it's picture and performance is way above the Samsung.

I am a long time Samsung fan and this tv was to replace and older Samsung 720I, my first one quit working after a couple of weeks, no picture or sound. I inquired about a replacement, which they did, however lied about shipping it back to me. I did my part and had it picked up in less than 24 hours, called and emailed the supplier that it had shipped, he told me that they would expedite the delivery, not! It took 5 days to receive and never sent a tracking number. As for the TV, I expected a great tv, but this one, like the other one, has a decent picture, not what I would call HD, the setup was very easy, the sound is fine. It is a disappointment and I should return this one and get a Sony.

I had a Samsung Smart TV that was hit by lightning.  I replaced it with what I thought would be a comparable TV.  The remote is terrible, the sleep timer is inconvenient, the color is almost impossible to set.  There is nothing about this unit that is as nice as my previous unit except it was cheap.  I was very disappointed in my purchase.  Had it not been for a guest room, I would have returned it.

Honestly, some of the features saved this product from getting a lower review, BUT with that being said...THE LAG IS TERRIBLE. You'll think the TV didn't get your input from the controller but it did...it's just as slow as a 95 windows buffering a YouTube video. Picture looks great though. Oh, and WHY is the sleep timer options either an hour or two? Where is my 90 minute option? Movies are usually 90 minutes, so it would make sense that you would include that in the timer options...idk

reviewTitle: backlight and brightness aree very poor
reviewDescription: don't like the backlight and ESPECIALLY the BRIGHTNESS....haven't decidedn if i will return this or not...My 15 year old polaroid finally crapped out, but it had a much brighter picture...i have this  samsung in my wood shop in the exact same location and i have to have two more flourescent lights on to even come close to what the polaroid picture was  !!!!!!!finally decided to return it....bought a vizio for less money and it is much much much better...could adjust everything about picture.....on samsung could not adjust anything

The sound and picture are good, but for me, I wish the antenna scanning function had the ability to manually scan for a channel. The tuner is good for reception and I don't much pay attention to other functions. I don't use online services so I skipped that setup. Now, every time I hit exit on the remote, I get a pop up saying to set that up. It's annoying.

We have had trouble with this tv not turning on right.  One day, it just wouldn't turn on at all.  Luckily, my IT guy at work told me to unplug it (we have one at our Library that is the same model)....it worked.  Then, last week, the screen turned a funky shade of blue.  Turning off then on didn't clear the problem but unplugging it did.  Sometimes the sound doesn't come on with the tv.  I don't know what's up with this model but it definitely isn't my old Samsung.  Not satisfied at all.

It has a fantastic picture but the sound quality is awful. The remote has dedicated buttons for Netflix and prime video but the design is poor at best. Buttons are small. A bonus with the tv is Samsung Tv Plus which is live tv. Navigating from the home menu is tedious as is adding apps. I would not buy this tv again.

I bought this because of the physical size. I have a limited space for it.First thing i ran into was only 2 HDMI ports. I had to buy a switch. Second, the only audio out is optical. Since my wife listens to her Bose speaker and i with my hearing aids i had to buy a splitter. Also no Bluetooth.The main issue is that for whatever reason, lip-sync keeps changing.

TV showed up in an undamaged box. Assembled legs and plugged in. Picture looks good as expected. Unfortunately the sound is junk. Suspect cracked speaker as all that is heard out of the right side is a crackled resemblance of what should be sound

The tv look is amazing sleek and light. My problem is with the apps. In order to work it you have to download an app with is ironic since it’s missing my favorite apps and I would have to get an Roku device to get my favorite apps smh.

reviewTitle: Samsung favoring their own streaming content
reviewDescription: What's with manufacturers sacrificing the quality of their own hardware in order to try to establish their own streaming services?  The FIRST option every time we turn on the TV is "Samsung TV" which isn't really TV at all as we think of it, it's Samsung's darn streaming service.  Worse, if you are changing inputs and don't move fast, it will default back to "Samsung TV" again.  Fine if you want to offer that service, but it's another thing to put it as a barrier to getting to the services a household most likely uses - i.e. an HDMI input or broadcast.

Picture is ok, not as sharp as I was expecting. I didn't realize this was a model from a couple of years ago. Can't use my soudbar with it, don't know why no audio output, and won't work with optical cable, or RCA. Not good for casting from mobile or laptop, keeps saying this TV only casts to selected video, I have to go through Fire stick or Chromecast,which sucks, I usually just use HDMI directly to computer which is a big pain. I wish my dog hadn't broken my 40" Insignia. Samsung quality has gone way downhill recently. Worst remote control I've ever used, not very user friendly.

reviewTitle: Tv is great but the remote stopped working after a month
reviewDescription: Tv works as expected and we enjoy the smart feature but the remote completely stopped working after a month. Tried new batteries and the troubleshooting guide with no luck. To my knowledge, nothing happened to it. Now we’re having to purchase another remote after having the tv for one month. Very disappointed.

I'm so underwhelmed with this Smart TV performance, that it should be ranked lower ratings! Let's start with the audio quality: even with adjusting the factory sound, the sound quality still mimics an AM radio station!Second, the remote control barely works, especially when batteries were replaced! Third, preloaded channels are the pits, but what is more irritating is the SMART TV makes it very difficult for the user to change viewing platforms using the remote! It often takes me up to 7minutes just to obtain access to my Hulu account because my remote doesn't work, forcing one to view the Samsung screen with those awful preloaded channels!This item will definitely be returned...I am not impressed!

What I did not like was that when it was connected to wifi with the cable connected, we could only stream or was stuck with Samsung’s useless offering. There was no option to watch our 89 fiber optic channels. After a few colorful metaphors, I figured out to I had to turn off the wifi.  So much for a “Smart” Tv. Would not buy again.

The picture is excellent, but the sound not so much. Turned all the way up to "100", whatever that means, sometimes the audio is barely audible. Watching some movies it's almost impossible to hear and understand the dialogue. And with musical performances, it's even worse. The one thing that can be said is that even turned up all the way, there is no distortion. But that doesn't make up for the lack of volume.(EDIT) The sound issue has just become more and more annoying. Watching movies is a pain. In order to hear the dialogue in most movies the volume MUST BE turned up to 100. And sometimes that's not enough! We've resulted more than once to turning on captioning Just So we can know what's being said. This is VERY ANNOYING! We never had that problem with the TV this one replaced. If we could send it back, we certainly would!

reviewTitle: Great while it lasted, but you'd be wise to purchase the warranty.
reviewDescription: Bought mine April 18, 2021 and it worked perfectly great until September 14, 2022. Now there's no sound from the speakers. They won't repair items under $500 so they called it a loss and credited my account to buy another.

I have always bought Samsung products I believe in them highly. However, this television set had a very boxy sound that would come and go and then all at once it is so boxy now that you can't understand what anybody says. I requested a return from Amazon on the 16th of May and still have heard nothing back!

reviewTitle: Great TV as long as your viewing it right in front of the TV
reviewDescription: If you try to watch this TV from the side the picture is terrible (which I sometimes do because it's in my kitchen and try to watch from the side while I'm doing dishes). It's contrast and brightness is hard to watch. white images look yellow.  I returned in about a week. Otherwise viewing from the front has a great picture.
Great picture. It is preloaded with apps. It would not allow me to add my tv provider.

I’ve had Samsung tvs for a long time.when hanging up my fams new 80inch Samsung they were able to use the same screws the wall mint came with, Not true for my mew 40inch. I have the bracket to hang up the tv damn screws are to small for the holes in tv. Disappointed ☹️
The remote is not very easy to use

Great TV. picture and features are super except the Sleep mode is difficult. Older units have a sleep button on the remote not this one. It take several step to set the sleep timer so it makes it not user friendly.
Tv came fast and was in perfect condition. Personally I love the picture of Samsung tvs and they are reasonably priced!

reviewTitle: Good tv remote could be better
reviewDescription: The tv has a good picture quality and is easy to use. The remote doesn't have lighted keys nor voice control so it's not easy to use if you're sight impaired. Linked to Alexa but there's not many commands available.

reviewTitle: Great picture, not the best placement of connections
reviewDescription: This is generally a pretty good TV so far; I've only had it for a couple of months. The reason I didn't rate it 5 stars is due to the fact that many of the connections are covered by the mounting plate. I think this would be the case with any mounting product. Once the plate is mounted to the rear of the TV, it's very difficult to access the optical cable connection. Seems like a pretty dumb design flaw especially considering that the optical cable is included with the TV. The HDMI cables are still accessible with the mounting product I used and would be with most others. The Antenna/Coax is also still accessible, and I'm only connecting those two cables. If you wanted to connect more items and use a mount it might not work well. Otherwise it's a good TV with a great picture and easy to use functions. If you only need the HDMI and antenna connections you should have no problems.

If came earlier than expected, but that's not a bad thing. This product is easy to lift (do be careful since modern TVs tend to be easy to break), easy to understand and use. The picture quality is very good and I've chose to not use the smart TV section for now since I have a Roku streaming device. I would personally recommend this product and for anyone still iffy about buying a TV from Amazon, I say go for it.

reviewTitle: Sound and Smart features aren’t great
reviewDescription: I purchased this tv because I have confidence in Samsung TVs. The two things I don’t like about this TV are the sound quality and the smart features. The *sound quality is a HUGE step down from the Samsung 42” which has incredible sound. This (32”) model is just tolerable and won’t give and low end response. I know that you can’t expect much in the way of internal speakers, but this TV REALLY misses the mark.The Smart Features aren’t great either due to a poor interface but like the sound quality,  they are tolerable.Good enough for the price I paid, but I guess I expected a slightly better product.*note that I am an audiophile and former music engineer/producer, so some people might not notice the sound quality.

I got this to show my digital artwork, which it does admirably. It has brilliant color and good resolution. My digital painting has improved simply by being able to see my work at the size intended.It comes with Samsung free TV, which I was not expecting. But, as with most cable,  satellite, etc., lots of shows, nothing to see. I was surprised at how smart smart TV is. It has many features I will probably never use, but as a 'picture frame,' I love it.
it was to small fro us.

Not a bad TV for the price.  Picture and sound quality are quite good.  Navigating the channel lists are cumbersome, and the TV doesn't have nearly the options that our old non-smart TV had for customizing the picture, sound, and selecting channels.  On using the built-in web browser, I logged into Facebook, and within 24 hours my Facebook account which I'd had for 15 years was stolen.  I won't be logging into any of my online accounts, but use the browser for general surfing only.

reviewTitle: Will not download terms of service; doesn’t work without it
reviewDescription: I received the TV today and will return asap.  In order to use the features I bought this tv for (to use the apps and spectrum service) you must download the terms of service.  I connected my internet just fine, yet when I attempted to download the terms of service it said my internet connection wasn’t stable and it quit.  My connection is 200 mbps.  I went through 4 wifi routers.  I went to the neighbors.  I tried a wifi hotspot.  6 total internet connections and none of them are good enough for this television.  All of my devices run just fine on my internet, yet this TV is so advanced that it can’t?  So I called Samsung customer service.  They wanted the error message and when I told them they said nothing is wrong with the tv, and that my internet doesn’t work.  Can you imagine?  To make a tv that is the only electronic device I’ve come across in decades which I can’t get to work with my internet?  Yet it isn’t their fault.  So I’m returning it and will never, ever purchase a Samsung anything ever again.EDIT:I've changed the review from a 1 star to 3 stars as I figured out the issue.  Samsung customer service was no help, and I took to the internet to see if others had similar issues.  There was no shortage of people who had the same issues I did, however I couldn't find a solution.  After a few hours of searching and reading, I came across a post which stated that the reason for the internet issue is because the TV was originally set up in another country, and the TV won't connect to Samsung if a different country than the original is detected.  To get around this, one must 'reset' the TV, which is an option deep into the settings menu.  I did this and was able to successfully set up the TV.  This should be an easy fix for Samsung, and certainly a troubleshooting step, however it's not.  Their answer is simply "your internet doesn't work, get a better internet connection."  Unacceptable they have this flaw, unacceptable they don't acknowledge it, unacceptable I have to go deep into internet research to fix it, and unacceptable you can't use basic functions of the television because they gate keep it.
A pretty good TV other than you can't add other apps to it, yes Amazon Prime & Netflicks are included on the remote but if you want something besides what came from the factory you're SOL.

reviewTitle: BUYER BEWARE.  Why don't they show the apps in the pics??
reviewDescription: No HULU. If you want a Smart TV, this is not the one.Just arrived today; set it up, signed into wi-fi, etc. Hulu is NOT pre-loaded so went to apps settings. Hulu is not available. Called customer service - HULU IS NOT COMPATIBLE. WITH. THIS. MODEL. What?!?! Sooo, this is an elementary-school smart TV. NOT college or even high-school smart TV.  I didn't know there were levels; either it is or it is not Smart. The TV comes with 15 apps pre-loaded; additional 46 apps are available for download (some free(?)), some free-Trial, most paid subscription. A small enough catalogue they could list them all in the description - but they don't. Picture and sound are average; remote has lots of buttons; more than my other TV's. Kinda like that. Just wanted a smaller-than-me (less than 50 inches) Smart TV for this space.option 1 - return this TV and buy a bigger oneoption 2 - purchase ADDITIONAL component (firestick, roku, etc)option 3 - We CAN cast our phone (which DOES have Hulu) to play over the TV.This review is written 2 hours after opening the box.

3 stars because we had to return this model TV two times due to sound malfunctions, but the picture is great.  Also, the TV is easy to set up and choose options.  The sound issues were just unreliable.  I see others have mentioned sound issues, too, in the reviews.  On the first one we got, sometimes we would have to turn the sound up to 99 to barely hear it; unplugging it seemed to correct it. On the second one, the sound would suddenly blast and voices would be garbled.  Changing the sound settings made no difference. If you are looking for a 32" (rare to find), and don't mind unplugging it when the sound misbehaves, it might be a good buy for you.
REMOTE CONTROL IS HARD TO USE ! LIKES TO JUMP AHEAD A BUNCH ! UNABLE TO JUST GET ONE OR TWO CHANNELS .......... JUMPS WAY AHEAD !!!!!  Of where ya Want to GO !
besides the dark screen, its a great TV.
I have had this for 2 years and the sound would change volumes.  Finally in 2024 the sound was gone.  Repairman suggested a sound bar.
Clear optics Well see about Durability

The TV, on its own, is very good for this price point.The remote, on the other hand, is outdated along with the operating software in the TV. The software is not intuitive at all and the clunky remote only makes navigating to what you want to watch worse. The process to connect a phone to hot spot it is ridiculous.

reviewTitle: First and last Samsung for me!
reviewDescription: Great! It's a "smart" TV. But I have had to do a factory reset on it twice because the sound suddenly went to max volume and could not be turned down. And I absolutely detest the remote control. The least intuitive and ergonomic remote I have ever used. Should've known better after seeing many Samsung cell phones at work swell and crack or pop the backs off. Never had that problem with Motorola or Apple phones.

reviewTitle: They don't make TV's like they used to
reviewDescription: I had a Samsung for 14 years, bought in 2018  and had to be replaced (picture blew out), so I bought this one.  I'm astounded at how cheap it is, the LED lighting is too bright, colors "too" enhanced - seem surreal, and the puny feet to the TV are crooked and so I have to prop them up with magazines.  There's also a big glare that I can't get rid of.  Generally all TV's made today are marketed as "the clearest picture ever," but the LED and QLED lighting actually work to burn out your eyes - my eyes are exhausted after just a few hours of watching this TV.  I'm at a loss as to what to do -- I can't find any TV's that don't offer LED (light-emitting diodes) technology, which is just awful and hard on the eyes as I mentioned.  Way over-priced as well.
I nearly returned this due to the unstable sound and volume. These can be improved upon in Settings but the default setting was quite unstable and unsatisfactory.

reviewTitle: remote control is terrible! cumbersome to say the least and, especially,
reviewDescription: at night, and I even, FYI, wear prescription reading glasses, have a night light, yet I still can't fumble through this, again, cumbersome, non-neon capable, seems to only exist for itself rather than for me, the user, remote "control" (?)
The remote is outdated and not user friendly. Picture is great and amazing free TV.

Bought this TV 4 years ago to the month. It did well being on 98% of the time. It bit the dust with the Black Screen Death. All attempts to revive it failed (soft and hard reset, checked all connections, etc.) Sound is still good though (with the sound bar, of course).  I think I'll move up to the M Series.

This is a good tv for what I needed it for, but too darn glitchy. Fortunately I was able to find the fixes online, but still. I have the TV hooked up to HDMI so that I can get Xfinity and I also have an old school Blu-ray player connected. I find at least once or twice a week I have trouble with any any of the sources including Netflix and the other applications. I find that simply unplugging for 10 seconds and plugging back in fixes this issue but it's still annoying and unnecessary. With the Blu-ray player sometimes that doesn't work so I have to do the same thing. Other than those annoyances it's a good TV. I have it in my basement and watch it every morning when I work out. It's just the annoyances of having to fix those glitches that are totally unnecessary.

reviewTitle: Good picture but not that smart
reviewDescription: The picture is good but the setup was not easy and the smart part was poor.

reviewTitle: Had to send the first one back
reviewDescription: Had to send the first one back. The screen was black and we could not get it to work even after consulting a professional videographer. The second one worked but no screws were included in the package. My husband spent hours going through his supply to finally find 4 to mount the tv onto its legs. Still haven't figured out how to use it but I think that will come. 3 stars maybe

reviewTitle: Very Good Value; Remote Could Be Better
reviewDescription: My only criticism of this TV is a minor one: the remote is a little challenging for my fingers. I often hit the wrong button.But the TV itself, from the quality of the images to the ease of programming, I love! Super simple to get started right out of the box. Good quality, fair price. Maybe get the next larger size next time.

The TV has a good picture and is easily operated. For the money, it's a good value. I will mention that I was disappointed in the shipping process. it took over 10 days for the TV arrived and finally received message that the first shipment was damaged. Amazon was good about customer service.

reviewTitle: Remote Doesn't Work All The Time
reviewDescription: I have had this Samsung TV for a few weeks and the remote didn't work last week.  I replaced batteries, and once again today the remote did not work.  There is no other way to turn on the TV, so I need a new remote.  Otherwise, if it turns on, it has a very nice picture.Please send a new remote for this TV.Thank you.
Only use the tv for broadcast. So I can’t comment on the smart features. Picture is beautiful, remote work great

Tv works fine, only problem is with streaming from Hulu. A few times a day it totally shuts down and you have to start the program over. Picture is of good quality, good sound, color is good. Easy to set up.
Was expecting more real estate with this TV.
Legs to far apart for my TV stand.
Thanks the Samsung is great. I love the picture and sound.
Remote kinda difficult to use.
Liked everything but the remote's small buttons. Cumbersome design.

It's a beautiful picture quality. Sound is great. Occasionally it "blinks," and goes black. I'm not sure if that's Netflix or the TV. Love the use of apps. Comes preloaded with Netflix and Prime Video. Yay. Perfect size for an RV bedroom. One thing I noticed, which is not the TV's fault, is that if you are using a jetpack for internet (due to being in an RV,) you cannot use Prime Video most of the time due to the streaming being too high a quality for (Verizon) streaming. I would recommend getting a 720p, as adjusting the quality of the streaming in Prime on this TV appears to be impossible. Also, who makes a remote without back lit buttons in this day and age? I have to turn on the light at night to use it...uncool Samsung.
Great picture and sound.I wish it had voice control on the streaming channels. You have to buy an Alexa product.

I'm never happy that I need to have a small TV. At first I had trouble using my sound bar with this TV. Then discovered how to make this happen all the time. I wish there were more instructions included with today's electronics, but I am lucky to have a relative who teaches at MIT. reviewTitle: Able to Link Optical Audio Output to RF Headphone System for Hard-of-Hearing
reviewDescription: I am going to address just this one aspect since solving it was not as simple as I had hoped. I already had a Sennheiser RF transmission headphone system that accepted analog audio input from an older Samsung TV. This model TV, like most, no longer provides analog audio output. So I purchased an analog-to-digital converter, also from Amazon, made by Techole. Here is what I had to do to get it all working: (1) As other have written, notice that there are almost invisible flexible protective coverings on both ends of the optical cable provided with the Techole adapter; you will need to scrape these off using your finger nail. This then plugs into the optical audio out port in the TV and the in port in the converter. (2) You will need to locate in Samsung settings, under Audio and then Expert Settings the two entries related to HDMI and switch them to the PCM option. (3) I used the red and black (importantly, not yellow, which is video) RCA input jacks in the hard-wired cable to my Sennheiser to connect to the output of my Techole adapter; other means of connecting (e.g., using a headphone jack) should also work. (4) With this done, I could hear audio through my Sennheise headphones whether or not the TV was in mute mode and whether I was using conventional TV input from my Verizon box or separate input from my Samsung BluRay/DVD plalyer. The problem was that I could not hear through the headphones if I had selected an alternate source (Netflix, Amazon, etc) from the TV itself. After an extensive chat session with Samsung support, we finally found that if I disconnected the TV power from the wall and disconnected all connected cables and then reconnected and powered up the TV, all worked fine. Good luck.

I am very happy and impressed with this TV.  We have been using ours for a few months in the kitchen area, and it has performed flawlessly.The picture quality is great!  It is sharp, bright, and very natural looking.  I think the 1080P feature helps too, and is worth the slightly higher cost of this TV over comparable models.  But a great picture requires a little extra initial work.  When setting up any TV, you'll find that there are many picture adjustment options; some are on/off, some are selections, and some are ranges.  Yes, it's a little tedious, but take the time to go through each option and set it to what looks good for you.  The effort is totally worth the enhanced enjoyment of your TV viewing.The sound quality of this TV is also excellent for its size.  Conversations are crisp, music is pleasant, and the volume can go up much higher than I would ever want.  Remember that you are listening to the built-in speakers of a relatively small television, so don't expect the same sound quality as you get from your Dolby 5.1 surround-sound entertainment system!Other reviewers have complained about WiFi connectivity problems (connections lost), but we have not had this problem.  Perhaps it's a function of signal strength or modem brand?We are very happy with our purchase of this TV, and I recommend it highly.

reviewTitle: Excellent TV, needs a small gadget to use bluetooth.
reviewDescription: It is four stars only because you need an additional gadget to set up bluetooth. The rest is top-notch.I have this TV for couple weeks and love the picture quality, the size of TV, and the price. Being Samsung TV, it has tons of Samsung TV channels, plus I use smart TV apps, and a few local TV channels I receive with a small indoors antenna (I have no cable TV subscription).It took to time to set it up, Wi-Fi connection did not work and I use ethernet, but I guess it is caused by the router being in another room.I am close to illiterate in tech gadgets and I am not paid to promote other Amazon products.I like to use headphones, but this TV has no bluetooth in it. If you go to TV settings - sound, it says something like HDMI-ARC. After googling all these mysterious words and reading answers about this TV, I bought "HDMI ARC Adapter Audio Converter"https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B0791CFGY1/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o00_s01?ie=UTF8&psc=1I already had (also bought on  Amazon) bluetooth transmitter receiver, and bluetooth headphones.https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B09DD33SDD/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o02_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B09JGF23V3/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_asin_title_o01_s00?ie=UTF8&psc=1I paired these headphones with bluetooth a few days ago (they said "paired" but had no sound).I connected the converter to the HDMI ARC in TV via HDMI cable, and also to USB in the TV as power supply. Then I connected the converter to the bluetooth transmitter via audio cable (red and white cables), and got a great sound in my headphones.I had the TV connected to a soundbar via optical cable. Now I can use only soundbar (ot TV speakers without the soundbar), only bluetooth headphones, or both at the same time.The sound quality is very good. If you are looking for the best listening experience (bass, various music etc.), I can't answer because I was looking for a good quality sound via headphones and I got it.Overall, I highly recommend this TV.

reviewTitle: Good for a spare room or bedroom, built in speakers audio quality could be better.
reviewDescription: Good choice for use in a spare room or bedroom. built in speakers audio quality could be better. If you don't opt in on the Smart TV features and data collection you are constantly annoyed with a pop up on power on or exiting from different programming options encouraging you to turn on the Smart features. Why would you not want to turn on Smart features? Perhaps like me you do not want to share your TV usage data with Samsung and 3rd party affiliates.  Even with Smart features disabled when you have connected to your home network via Ethernet cable or WiFi you can access shared hard drives on devices attached to your home network. I did not have to enter the userid and password Windows 10 usually requires to access these shared devices between Windows computers. Was able to access the external drive attached to my home router without entering a userid and password, not sure how this magic is happening. May be a security concern for some. The dismal audio quality from the built in speakers reminds me of what I heard watching my parents 1964 vintage Zenith 19 inch black & white TV. Audio quality might improve if you use a soundbar. Was hoping to test it with a pair of good quality amplified computer speakers however the only audio output options are an optical cable or HDMI ARC connection. No Bluetooth. HDMI cable not included with TV. Only cable included is the power cable. Remote control is easy to use and includes numerics making it easy to select off the air channels. Was able to easily configure the remote for my DIRECTV Satellite receiver to control TV power on/off and volume. When turned off a RED LED is illuminated on the bottom right of the TV bezel which may be annoying to some insomniacs.

reviewTitle: The stand could use a lot more stability.
reviewDescription: Picture is good but sound needs a sound bar or amplifier for improvement.  The stand, such as it is, needs improvement.  It is not very stable.

I returned a popular smart tv that had a problem with audio synch that could not be fixed by calling the manufacturer. I carefully repacked in the original box. Amazon return policy is excellent. I then ordered thisi Samsung model and saved $40. This Samsung has a much better picture quality and overall much better than the brand I returned to Amazon. Before setup, have your wifi password available. Setup is a little tricky. Carefully go thru the steps. Don’t rush. During the setup you can add apps to the preloaded lineup. You can select Hulu, Utube, travel and others to the standard lineup that are listed when you push the home button on remote. During setup you have to setup a Samsung account which I found annoying. They strongly encourage you to get an app for your phone that cost me $20 and found it to be of little use since my iphone mirroring feature did more. Do not get it,  its a waste of money. Somewhere on the main menu look for a sub menu that has apple play option and switch to on so your iphone mirroring will work. Also there is a smartcast setting that may work with android phones. Phones must be using same wifi as tv. I had a problem programming the xfinity cable box remote for tv volume/power control. I moved the cable box from blocking the lower right corner of the tv and it worked. The Samsung remote has large number keys prominently displayed at top of remote that you rarely use while some of the often used keys are smaller and not well placed. There are a,b,c,d colored buttons that seem to have no function.  In settings for picture and audio control there are a few choices for preset settings. You cannot select individual color, brightness, bass, treble etc. I was ok with the picture selections but would like to add more bass to the sound but cannot. Overall, its a very good smart tv at a great price. Update. After almost 2 years still a great tv. Recommend getting a Roku streaming device with TV controls ($40) for easier and faster use than the Samsung remote.

For anyone having a question answered positively, A picture is worth a thousand words so I took 4 pictures equaling 4,000 words of proof that this great brand Samsung TV is definitely wall mountable and with No Hassle at all. There are 4 flat head screws on the back where there is a bulge in the back cover where the electronics are in. Simply remove the 4 metric flat head screws and lay your wall mount bracket over the holes to line them up appropriately  and replace the screws. Only issue I had with it was the flat head screws were too small in diameter and slipped thru the holes in my wall mount bracket so I simply put a washer on each screw and BINGO... There you go. If the factory screws are too short for your wall mount bracket, simple go to and hardware store and they will match up the threads for you with a longer screw, but be careful, Do Not use a replacement screw that is much longer than the original.
simple to set up.

I love this TV. It allows you to connect HDTV through the back coax connector. The pic is very clear and crisp. Sound is loud enough. Great size to have in a small place. I recommended. I do think I should have gotten the 40” though. Thanks
great TV at a great priceI do not know how the supply chain can deliver a product of this quality at such a super low priceBUY ONE!!!!

reviewTitle: Good quality in a smaller TV
reviewDescription: I wanted a TV to wall-mount in my bedroom where I have limited space. I was a little surprised to learn that it's actually getting difficult to find a top-quality TV in a smaller size these days - this Samsung was about the best we could find in a 32" model. Still, despite it's small size, it does have all the essential features, as well as a very good picture quality.The TV itself is very light weight and was easy to wall mount. I used an articulating arm mount that lets me tilt and position the TV any way I want, and the light weight helped make this easy. The TV remote is the same as other recent Samsung TV's use, so if you're used to the layout, it will seem very comfortable to you.This is a "smart" TV, meaning that it has apps for things like Netflix, Amazon Prime Video and many others available. With a fast internet connection, you should have no trouble watching whatever you like through the TV, even if you're a cord-cutter. It's probably a small thing to most people, but I also appreciate that the power draw - especially when the TV is off - is very low.I'd rate the picture quality as very good overall, with a nice bright picture that's sharp and contrasty with most content. Black levels are good, and about the only thing I notice is a certain "harshness" that's common to lots of TV's these days. I admit, I was a plasma holdout, and now my main TV is a 75" OLED just to avoid this issue, so I may be a little more sensitive than most.Overall, if you need a good quality smaller Smart TV that's still capable of putting a nice quality image in front of you, then this Samsung is definitely worth a try.

I just had a Samsung 40 inch go out after 5 -6 years with lots of use... The screen went dead,m you could still hear sound. This is the second one the screen has gone out on in the last 10 years... My guess it is planned obsolescence the name of the money game to get us to buy more... My first one was a 39 inch and it was replaced under the first year warrantee and is still going strong???
