How long I do not know... It looks like Samsung has discontinued its 40 inch screen line! I have 3 areas that will only take 40 inch screens...  I may have to buy something other than Samsung when the next on goes bad?Otherwise, for the cost it is prorated at about  $40 dollars a year to have their tv's so far for all three... I'm now checking out different manufactures for 40 inch HD tvs...

reviewTitle: Great TV - set up very fast!
reviewDescription: Bought this Samsung TV to upgrade in my living room.  It shipped fast, was in new good condition no issues and set up was very easy!  I am very happy with this product.
Vary nice smart tv. Super simple to setup and it comes with Samsung tv plus for free. A TON of channels. Picture quality is outstanding sound quality is pretty good too.

I purchased the 2019 television because it was priced well, and is quite suited for my needs.The Samsung band name attracted me, since that company has high quality.  The picture is excellent, and the setup went smoothly, even though I had to go through multiple levels of security to get registered.The product is a great value.

reviewTitle: Just what I was looking for
reviewDescription: Needed to replace my 14 year old 26" Samsung flat screen TV .... which was still working just fine ... with something that was: a little larger, fit into the same space, was more energy efficient, would not FORCE me to use the smart TV features (and get tracked even more than I already am), and had a better tuner (yes, we also do some over the air broadcast watching). This model fit the bill. It was a great price, of course a solid brand with excellent reviews, fit the same spot without a complete rearrange of the living space, let me plug in my Roku and never miss a best, and seems to use about 1/4 the electricity of the old LCD screen. I can't comment on the internal speakers, since I have it wired to my soundbar/theater speakers. In short, it's pretty much perfect.
For a happy family, make sure everyone has their space for the own small tv! Money well spent for our daughters playroom! We always buy name brand when it comes to our TVs. Great quality everytime!
NO LEGS FOR TV!!@!!!

The sound blew out after only 4mos. And Joni don’t blast the volume up so other than it being poor quality there is no reason this should have happened. I ended up buying a sound bar instead of a new tv

reviewTitle: Picture is dark and sound is gargled
reviewDescription: Worst tv ever. Worked good for two days. Yesterday the picture started to get darker and brightness is on max and won’t adjust. Turned it on this morning and the sound blasted and is so gargled it can’t be understood. Adjusting it doesn’t do anything to help. The worst part is that we are in a motorhome 1400 miles from home and now need another tv not a Samsung.
It worked fine until it failed, now it won't power up.  DISAPPOINTING, to say the least!!!
Picture gets dark for no reason, sound is muffled at times
I expected this tv to be Alexa enabled by the way listing was written. It is not Alexa compatible.

I used this primarily as a 1920x1080 computer monitor with my laptop, and occasionally for TV and Netflix. I loved this monitor with its crystal clear display and its bright color display, but 26 months after I bought it, it died. It would cost $200 to get it repaired, so it does not make financial sense to repair it. It was a great monitor, but it should have lasted at least five years, not two.

reviewTitle: I am not satisfied with this TV.
reviewDescription: It doesn't have bluetooth, the picture quality isn't all that great, and the sound quality is terrible.I bought a soundbar, and the only way I could hook it up was via the optical connection, it also doesn't have a 3.5 jack.  I should have spent a little bit more. You get what you pay for.

Overall, a very nice TV, but a recent update to the operating software makes this model now unable to download and install the Xfinity Stream app.  We have an older production run of the identical model number which runs Xfinity Stream OK as do two other Samsung sets - one larger screen and the other smaller.  Samsung tech support did a full reset and update of the set online to no avail.  Since running Xfinity Stream was a primary need for this set, we returned it and ordered an Amazon Fire Smart TV, which both Amazon and Comcast say will run Xfinity Stream.

Picture quality is great. Input lag very noticeable, and remote has no voice search to make up for it. Can't get certain streaming apps (such as Crunchyroll, AMC+), and streaming from the browser is frustrating due to the input lag. Video and audio stutters are a recurring issue after the TV has been on a while. Also, used to stream a fire stick on a very old tv with no problems, on this TV there is severe video and audio lag when using the fire stick. Expected better for the price.

reviewTitle: Quality product, but with some annoying omissions
reviewDescription: The good: the actual TV. Picture quality is good, and it’s pretty user friendly. The bad: sound is weak, and the only output is optical so if you want to connect it to a wired system you need to buy an optical to RCA converter. Not expensive, but a 3.5 audio jack shouldn’t be too much to ask. It also doesn’t have Bluetooth, so that’s literally the only option unless you have Wi-Fi speakers. The remote is VERY cluttered - fortunately my old Samsung remotes work and do all the tasks I need. Lastly, the stand is pretty bad, so if you need to angle the TV up or down, well, you’re not going to! All in all a good quality smart TV for the price, but with some unfortunate hassles.

Feet very hard to install. You can not adjust tv to 16.9 ratio. Or movie mode. Only has standard option working. You loose a lot of the tv viewing size. Remotes buttons are very similar, so have to have light on to use. I usually love Samsung products, but this is a miss for me. It was for a bedroom use. Picture quality is good, just viewing size smaller than my last Samsung I had, but did not have wifi, so I opted to buy this. Don't know why it has options you can't use.

24 hours after receiving… not happy. As a older person the blasted remote is horrible. Still trying to get the picture size set using custom option.The picture is great I just need it to move up so I can read info on ESPN that is on bottom of screen. Trying to get info on remote and tv is not user friendly. Going to need one of our grandkids to come fix the screen size.  My smart TV makes me feel stupid.

reviewTitle: A smart tv for a technically challenged purchaser..questionable choice
reviewDescription: Size, weight, picture quality all good, sound ok for price. Amazon referred me to a samsung expert who was very difficult to understand even after repeating words or phrases more than once; eg..until I checked every label on the remote I had no idea he was referring to "setting."  He did get annoyed after my constant asking him to repeat a direction. He then would repeat but he would give me 3 or 4 directions, one after the other which made it even more frustrating for me to follow and frustrating for him having to repeat so many times. He did insinuate my inability to follow his directions was my problem not his. Disappointed that no printed manual comes with set even though some form of e manual is available on screen. Still cannot access basic channels Verizon said are available as before from the same cable box hooked up to set HDMI. Samsung agent could not help me with that problem. After his frustration and mine, we were disconnected. I experimented with the remote and realized many things I could access from the remote and still more that I could not access. Think I will really enjoy the TV if I can find some help online, from friends or acquaintances more technically savvy than I, or hopefully from some samsung webpage. Also not sure what free choices I have and which require membership with fees (or are there apps that require membership but no fees.  I admit, I am not smart enough to meet the challenge of my new TV.

I never owned a Samsung television but when I saw the price, I decided to give it a  try. It's the worse mistake I have ever made when purchasing electronics. I'm no expert, but I keep wondering what did I miss? I had no idea I would not be able to get local channels or hook into cable channels using my provider, which is DirecTV.  I am floored and am wondering whether it's worth it to return the television.

We have You Tube TV and trying to get it to work on this TV was a nightmare. It doesn’t come as one of the included apps. There are a number of SmartThings lookalike apps on the App Store, so finding the correct Samsung one is tricky. The remote doesn’t work very well and the setup is the worst I’ve seen on a tv. We finally did a workaround using the iPhone that is a bit cumbersome but it works. The TV itself seems okay, but if you use YouTube TV I’d opt for a different model.

The TV has a good picture. The remote they gave me was useless. The majority of buttons I pressed did nothing. Also there was no mention of a soundbar. Didn't realize I needed one until I received the TV. I have the volume at least eighty to hear anything. I went back the site and it took three clicks before I saw the soundbar.

reviewTitle: Good TV, lacking a few things
reviewDescription: Firstly, the picture quality is great. But in this day and age, MOST tv's are of comparable quality to each other. I don't see the hype to get a 4k or other expensive tv's unless you're really into sports. I've seen movies on these expensive tv's and I hate that it changes the movie movements and gives a completely different experience.Now to the issues I got with this TV. First, the mandatory setup with samsung SUCKS! Who wants to open up a tv box and be forced to setup a profile and connect to wifi? What if I got a firestick, which I do, and just wanna use that? What if I just wanna use my antenna? This was  BIG turnoff. Glad it was just for my mom. I would surely return it. Also, in this day an age, tv's should come with a wall mount. It's just a few dollars extra, and shouldn't be optional at this point.

The TV price was too good to be true, but you get what you pay for no capabilities for a head set and no sleep mode button when I go to sleep like to have TV shut off but they did not have the capacity but over all its a work horse and the picture quality is decent.  But if I want more I will have to pay minimum price $1000.

TV arrived as scheduled. Unfortunately, the mounting screws and leg covers were missing. Had to go to hardware store to get the correct screws to mount the legs. Not what I would call the best situation even for prime day deals. The leg cover plates would be nice but not necessary.

reviewTitle: 2 months and the sound is wacked
reviewDescription: Not used much and two months bought from amazon and the sound is wacked just junk. Now I'm stuck with a piece of junk.
It shouldn't be called a smart TV if it doesn't have Bluetooth

Very disappointed with the volume for this TV. This TV bought for my elderly mom who doesn't hear so well but loves her TV's.  Cannot believe the loudest volume on this device cannot be heard well by her across an average size living room.  If I hadn't disposed of the box so quickly, I would definitely be returning it.Otherwise, the picture is beautiful, nice HD.  Remote easy enough.
How is it that in 2021, Samsung - who is a leader in technology - sells a tv that has no bluetooth? The picture is great, the sound is great, but the lack of bluetooth makes this a huge fail.
Set up to use as a television should be easy. This one is frustrating. I bought it to be entertaining, and do not need it to talk to my refrigerator, dish washer or dryer.
I have to reconnect this TV every single time I go to use it. It’s the biggest pain in the butt and not at all worth it. Sound and picture suck too.
Can't control bass on audio setting...rattling.

reviewTitle: Not the same quality as my 15-yr old Samsung.
reviewDescription: Had to call on a couple issues, so far.  Customer service has been great.  TV does a lot of "buffering."  Seems to be made much more cheaply.

reviewTitle: Inferior sound quality. I ended up buying a new tv (different brand)
reviewDescription: Everything is OK, except sound quality. My $50.Trans Smart speaker i s much better than the TV's sound. I expected more from Samsung.

Tv will not turn on next day after having used streaming and apps. Have to unplug, wait 30 seconds (or more) or more, plug back in and turns on fine. There’s a direct correlation between using streaming features and not turning on. When only using cable service, seems to not have this problem. Concerned this issue may worsen over time. Also disappointed that its not Bluetooth and has no earphone jack!

Audio cuts out in the middle of watching things. Turning the tv off/on does not fix the problem. I’ve had to reset the tv by unplugging it, waiting 30 seconds and then plugging it back in. The Self Diagnosis option in Settings does nothing to fix this. Good luck getting help from Samsung.

reviewTitle: TV stuck in zoom mode and Samsung won't honor warranty
reviewDescription: This product failed after a few weeks of being installed.  The TV is stuck in a full zoom mode and Samsung won't honor their 1 year warranty.

reviewTitle: Bad sound quality, and you have to register with Samsung to use it
reviewDescription: I thought this TV was overrated. The setup instructions tell you to download an app and register (I have to become a commodity to turn on my new tv?), and in the middle of that there's an affiliate detour that tries to trick you into purchasing a subscription for something you don't need. Escaped that trap and turned it on, and quickly realized that good quality sound is not included, you have to buy a soundbar or some external system. It's a ripoff.

I purchased this Samsung TV to replace an identical Samsung TV that had quit working (black screen) after only two years of use.  This replacement Samsung TV stopped working after only 5 days!  I notified Amazon and a replacement is on it's way, but I am not very hopeful that the next replacement will be any better.Basically, the red power light which is on when the TV is not in use, will start blinking intermittently, (indicative of a faulty power module), and then the screen goes black and the TV cannot be powered on.I have always liked Samsung TV's, going back twenty years or so, but these last two Samsung TVs have really disappointed me.  If the replacement TV doesn't hold up, I will move on to a different brand.
The picture is always dark.I could not figure out how to connect the TV to my phone. I kept the TV because it was too much of a hassle to return it.

reviewTitle: Shipped without pertinent screws for feet.
reviewDescription: As a smart television, i think it has a lot of neat features as someone who has a galaxy smartphone / Samsung account. However the ball was dropped heavily in the fact that the 4 screws meant to secure to feet to the television did not ship with the product. I currently have the feet taped to the television in order to have a working unit until further notice.

I have comcast xfinity for my provider. I wanted a simple TV that I can plug in and use. I have a bluetooth headset that I want to install and my old TV could not do that. I saw this set is a new smart set and took that to mean I can use the headset with it. The problem is I can't even get my xfinity to work with it. It comes with it's own Samsung plan and channels.The workaround to install xfinity is long and hard. After two days I still don't have it working.I thru the box away all ready so shipping it back would be too hard so I am stuck with it. I am seriously thinking of just tossing it in the trash and get the old TV out of the closet.

reviewTitle: Does NOT have bluetooth capability! Not so smart...
reviewDescription: For a modern "Smart" TV, it sure was sad to learn that this TV doesn't have the basic, frequently necessary function of Bluetooth. Unless the sound system you are connecting to is WiFi (most aren't), you'll need to spend a hunk of more money so you can connect this TV to sound. Or you can go with a lot of wires stringing about... Samsung, you can do much better!

reviewTitle: You can't get all app channels with this tv
reviewDescription: The remote buttons are tiny and too close together so you are constantly accidentally pushing the wrong button if you aren't watching your fingers. You can't get all of your normal apps on this TV without buying an Amazon cube or roku style device. So disappointing. The sound and color are low so make sure you go into settings at adjust them first.  I would have returned it for a different tv but I missed my window by 5 days and didn't save the box because who needs to return a brand new TV. So disappointing for an old lady not to have her channels.

The light is showing by the top middle of the frame. I went with Samsung, even though it costs more than other brands, because we’ve always gotten their TVs with no problems but they’ve seemed to lower their quality since I’ve last purchased one.

reviewTitle: I thought my old tv was bad
reviewDescription: I like the quality of the tv. Customer service was fantastic. I have a couple of serious issues and a lot of ticky-tack fouls, but I have only had it working for three hours maybe something will change. If you hit a non-letter key while entering your username, you start over. The paper user guide that comes with it is worthless: there are no instructions on using the tv in it. I know it seems obvious, but the start-up manual does not tell you to plug the tv into power. The tv rejected my attempt to register it during set-up then refused to recognize my wireless internet. Customer service was fantastic, spent a hour helping me get through the mess. The menu is about 11 icons on the bottom of the screen. Most of them are subscriptions. Could not find a way to either delete them or to more the channels I want to the left so I don't have to click umpteen times to get past the ones I will never buy (Netflix, Disney, etc). When setting up, the skip button does not work; you have to click the next step number. Privacy Settings are ridiculously complicated; I gave up trying to figure out how to change them. Manual is useless in that regard (and just about every other regard as well). Adding a channel does not add it to the menu; you have to do that manually. Channels are considered apps; use the app button to add one. But after you add one, when you click the add button to add another, it takes you to the channel you just added, NOT to the add apps screen. Powering off and on worked sometimes to get back to the add apps screen but not often. Screens time out way too fast. Frequently the Home button doesn't, and you are left trying to figure out how to get out of a submenu on your own. With some items on the menu bar (like Disney), it is difficult to tell which icon is selected; you have to move the selection to figure it out. The on-screen keyboard is really screwy. Click a letter and a checkmark covers the letter to the left. If that is the letter that you want, you have to move left twice: once to the letter, which clears the check mark, and once to select the letter. Frequently the letter that is selected changes to a different letter when you move the selection, then changes back when you move the selection again. Frequently when you click the Setting button, the Settings screen does not open leaving you wondering what to do; actually the first couple times it happens, you don't know that anything is wrong, so the instructions, if you found any, appear to be wrong. I didn't find any info on the remote control, like what the PRE-CH and A, B, C, and D buttons do. That's enough; you get the idea. OK, I hate it so bad that I have to continue. The user interface is aweful. They are so busy trying to get you to watch the channels they want you to watch it becomes a chore trying to watch your channels. I have the Newsmax channel on in the background 4 to 6 hours a day. Every day I have to search for it. When I find it, they offer me Newsmax on Haystack. When I select Newsmax, one more time they offer Haystack. When you move the selection, I mentioned it above, it is hard to tell where you moved it to. While you are trying to find it, the thing times out, takes you somewhere you don't want to go, and you have to start all over. If I could afford it, I would toss the thing; I'm 74 years old and on a limited budge. I guess I'm stuck with this thing for the rest of my life. :(

reviewTitle: Good TV ruined by worst Remote Control on Earth.  One star for Crap manual and support .
reviewDescription: Don't count on Plug & Play with this "Smart TV". It makes you log in with a Samsung Account first. Don't have a Samsung Account cuz this is your first Samsung TV???Well prepare to spend up to an hour of your time trying to negotiate the On Screen Instructions cuz there is no printed manual to show you how to set up an account and the on screen instructions are confusing and inconsistent in language.User Name = email address.Bet you didn't know that?Menu pushes you to download the mobile App which is nothing more than a way to get to sign up for a paid subscription to Samsung, another source of income for an already expensive TV.Don't download the APP cuz you'll just delete it as soon as you realize you have to pay for it.The whole setup was so frustrating I looked for contact infor for Samsung I could call. There's no dialup help for new buyers, only an email that promises to respond to your Samsung Account. Oh, you don't have an account right?I then called Amazon Product support and spoke to a very nice man in Capetown, South Africa, I kid you not. He was very nice but only recommended I try to set up another Samsung Account to start over. I was gonna do that anyway, so no real help.If I knew all this before, I would buy another brand just for an easier set up and a remote control that is a confusion of buttons. I want one just like my DirecTV remote. Simple and direct.Samsung has zero support, terrible remote, no manual, up sells their App.I did eventually get to watch a very beautiful picture tho.If I had it to do over, I'd get another brand with better support.

reviewTitle: Updated for the 3rd time. Fix the closed captioning issue!!
reviewDescription: My old 32-in Samsung started having lines through it and acting weird so I bought this for myself for Christmas 2022 and decided to get a larger size. I love that it has more antenna channels than my old TV could find and the awesome bonus Samsung TV plus channels makes me feel like I have cable! LOVE IT!! After 2 weeks I came home and turned it on and the sound was very muffled so I called customer service and all I had to do was unplug it for 30 seconds and plug it back in. I am happy with it! I just hope there's no more issues with the audio because I saw a lot of reviewers talking about that. The remote is smaller than my other ones which is kind of a pain in the butt and I have small hands. So I use my older remote for certain things. Otherwise very pleased and thrilled that it has all the apps (even hulu!) except the CBS app and regular Paramount so have to use my roku on my other TV for that.Update oct 2023 so like many were saying about the audio it occasionally  BLASTS a muffled hot mess until you unplug it for a few. I ended up getting a soundbar which definitely helps me hear the TV better without blowing out the speakers. I dropped it down to a 5 star to a 3 because of the audio, the closed captioning and the auto smart hub feature. Every time I set up closed captioning it disappears again.. plus the smart hub auto runs even though that is always turned off.. I should not have to unplug my tv every single day or multiple times a day to get the closed captioning to stay on and auto hub to not pop up. I read that it's some kind of a bug in the code or something all I know is it's annoying. Even with the Soundbar I still like to be able to read what is being said so I don't have to rewind on an app or so I don't miss something on live tv because sometimes I don't understand what people are saying. Samsung do better with the closed captioning and make sure your settings stick!Updated December 14th 2023. I am so sick of the closed captioning issue I downgraded to a one star. Why is everything new crap?

I bought this on sale at Amazon during the Christmas holidays. It came when promised and I set it up with the help of the cable guy. I wanted to make sure I didn't screw it up. The picture, sound, and size were better than what I had expected. For five days I was in bliss. This was going to be a good year. All my favorite show would be a joy to watch. On the sixth day in the morning, I tried to turn the TV on with the cable remote. The cable box came on, but the TV did not. I tried the remote that came with the TV. Nothing. I tried again with the manual button and got nothing. I sent it back for a refund. Then I ordered another one just like the first. What would be the odds of two TV's doing the same thing? ( I really could have used Mr. Spock.) I set it up and it worked great. The next morning the same thing happened. This time I unplugged it, waited 30 seconds and plugged it in again. It worked. I called Sam Sung and spoke to an agent and told him everything. He said that the TV was making an adjustment and to give it a week to see if that would correct it and to call back if it happened again. Well, it happened again. This time he wanted me to unplug it and wait for 60 seconds, replug it and see if it happens again. If it does it again I'll speak to a supervisor. The model number isUN32N5300AF. I try to be patient with people and let them solve problems that come in front of them. I'm retired and I'm getting old. Some people may think me a fool, but I believe in giving people a chance. However, I can only go so long then things must change for the better. I hope this will help people in their choices. I hope you have better luck than me.

Purchase this Samsung 32 inch smart tv not even a month ago and it just constantly freezes, its undated with the latest 2501.1 upgrade, you can cycle the set for 30 second to 10 minutes and it still hangs and then freezes and for what ever reason it freezes on certain hd channels more than none hd channels.So much for smart tv's for me im returning this thing asap'11/27/23 Update,.. connected with Samsung tech support. the tech remoted my set, and without doing a reset, (undoing all my setting) the set hasn't frozen once,.. Caution' its only been accouple hours and i don't like leaving negative reviews, so i'll stay with this for a month or so, just to be fair to the brand'

I Purchased this TV and it was sent to me directly from Samsung Store. I opened the box and the first thing I noticed was the remote and the power cable was no on the original package. There was no package for those two items a all.  That's when I realized the TV was used. I didn't bather taking it out. Right away started the return proceeding and I want it to send an email to Samsung regarding this outrage situation. I need the TV but I don't trust them now. If I decide to purchase another, I'll need the guarantee it won't be a use one. I can't rate the quality of the features, because I didn't get a chance to use it.

reviewTitle: Software Crashed and Service is Fully Lacking
reviewDescription: After only six months of use, I turned the television on to find what I am told is a USB icon. Customer service indicated I had exhausted all possible fixes and they would escalate the issue and I would be contacted in 24 to 48 hours. After six days, I called back and was told it was never escalated (despite written confirmation that it was done). Now, I am being told I need to take it to a service place an hour from my house. I am already three hours into trying to get this repaired. Two round-trip drives to drop it off and pick it up would add four hours to the time I am spending on this. So after one week and too much of my personal time, I am cutting my losses and will simply purchase any other brand television.I dealt with Samsung customer service regarding my refrigerator and between these two experiences, I cannot suggest strongly enough to avoid this brand at all costs.

I so wanted this TV to be my bedroom TV but it is horrible.  It defaults to SamsungTV which has nothing I want to watch.  The remote is cumbersome and I can't get around using it because to get to YouTubeTV I have to do several actions with it.  It will not restart directly to the last app it was tuned to although it has that as an option in settings - it just does not happen.

I followed the instructions to download a USER GUIDE, but it directed my search to BEST BUY which now owns Insignia. Nowhere on the Best Buy web page is there a link to download manuals. I started a dialog to and was constantly told that someone would assist me. Finally, it timed out. I tried again and was given a link with instructions to download a file that was 45 MB on my computer and then download a program that would uncompress the 45 MB document. Unwilling to uncompress a huge document onto my computer, I gave up. I do not buy another Insignia or Best Buy product.
Both the initial tv i bought and replacement tv were damaged. I decided it was better to get a refund.

reviewTitle: The actual screen size of a 40 inch television is only 34.9 inches.
reviewDescription: The fact that is not clearly written  that if you buy a 40inch television the actual screen size diagonally is only 34.9 inches.  This is so wrong, the product information should clearly let the consumer know what is the actual screen size in the first paragraph.  It’s times the consumer get some respect from the manufacture and get what they are paying for.  What a shame that this deceptive practice is industry wide.  Why is this information buried?
I love Samsung televisions and have had a few but this model is not bright even after adjusting the brightness. I'm on the highest setting.  I'm very disappointed with this TV.

FIRST of all, Box came re-taped! We were on vacation, so by the time we got home to set this up and opened the box, we realized there are NO FEET in the box!! We literally could not set this tv up on our console... we will now have to mount it on the wall or return it. SO DISAPPOINTED!! Seems like Amazon purchases are getting worse and more careless. Will NOT buy again... :(

reviewTitle: Not so good. Not even close.
reviewDescription: This TV worked well for about a month and then it would not go on when we use the remote. I tried unplugging it and plugging it back in and it worked. It's a good TV if you don't mind unplugging and plugging it in again. Well it just keeps getting better all the time. I received an update the other and it felt it needed to be set up all over again. It went ok until it asked what language I spoke and now 3 days later I still cannot select my language. So I have no working TV. I am so sorry I wasted my money on this tv.

Every time there is a loud sound in a movie, it makes a boom sound, a horrible sound that stays with the movie for minutes. We tried getting a sound bar to help it out but nothing helped! I wouldn't recommend this TV to anyone!

reviewTitle: Very flimsy stand--likely to tip over
reviewDescription: Had to return. Surprised Samsung would put out a product with this extremely flimsy stand--an accident waiting to happen

I bought this TV to add Apps because I have a 58 inch Samsung that you can get them and antenna on.  All that I am able to get is the same channels that I was getting on a Firestick.  The old TV I replaced at least would get antenna TV.  Very disappointed with this product.  I should have returned it before the time ran out to send it back.

Screen is extremely fragile and it takes forever for the channels to change.So what idid was cut a piece of plexi glass the size of the screen and fixed it on there with tape ,now I can throw almost anything at it and I don't have to worry about it breaking!

i stiil watch  majority of shows via cable (mostly sports) and this unit has extremly poor compabiity with my system. Its okay when I use it for NetflIX/Amazon Prime or HULU but anything else it is clunky and mult-step. Remote is not compatible with my system so now I have the cable remote and the Sansung remote for volume--my LG was able to fully integrate both and that is what I would recommend. SAMSUNG provides thier own cable shows a wide selection but I would generously catergorie those shows as the D list

reviewTitle: My Remote Control is a Riddle
reviewDescription: I have to do everything but stand on my head to make this remote control work.  I've replaced the batteries, I've tried pointing it at every angle.  It has no sweet spot (I could live with that), but there is no rhyme or reason as to how to point this remote at the tv to make it work.  Please help!

Picture is very sharp.  My only quibble is that the color fades fast as you move off-axis.  This really only affects the picture if you are sitting VERY close to the TV and off to the side, or looking at it from an angle in passing; like from a doorway.  From any normal viewing angle it is excellent.  Shipping was excellent.  The TV arrived two days ahead of schedule.  Very satisfied so far!

The picture is great. The apps are great. Everything is great but the sound quality is poor. I have to crank it up to 75 or so to be able to hear what they’re saying (and I’m not hard of hearing). I also turn on closed captioning. I have another (larger) Samsung that is great. However, I wouldn’t purchase one again.

reviewTitle: Nice device but you may not like the TV plus interface
reviewDescription: A nice looking picture for the money BUT If you still subscribe to cable you will find the Samsung "TVplus" app a pain in the neck - a cluttered screen that is hard to navigate and full of commercials you don't want to see.  We found the easiest (maybe the only) way to navigate around it is to use the Samsung remote for on-off and settings and your cable remote for everything else (you'll have to on-off that too).
Size is good picture is ok, but sound very low even on max, I can’t hear what ppl say in the movies, have to put subtitles (( kinda annoying

reviewTitle: Great TV WITH HULU but poorly made remote
reviewDescription: Great TV that absolutely has HULU. I don't get the people saying it doesn't. The downfall with this TV is, the remote is the most poorly designed piece of alleged technology I've ever seen. It could not be harder to use if you had to hold angry bees while navigating the apps.
The remote is so cluttered that it is hard to use. The arrow On the Internet is hard to control.

Works great.  Actually uses my 5Ghz WIFI.  Remote batteries INCLUDED. Did not have to scan for local channels.  It found all of those on its own!I use this primarily with my Xfinity box. Somebody asked why I did not just get a monitor.  HDMI monitor with sound would have been more than this TV,  Go figure.

reviewTitle: It was maybe an inch longer on the outside frame than my previous 32" Samsung.
reviewDescription: I had some trouble with the setup ...  I have to laugh about it now, but make sure your cable box is turned on or you won't connect to anything-  even the WIFI.  There's a lot of extras that comes with the Smart functions - I'm still looking through everything available.  Great picture, big improvement over my 720 pixels, although I didn't realize it was a 60 hertz frame-rate when I ordered it.  1080p is perfect for a 32" flat screen; I honestly wouldn't bother with the 4K or higher on this size screen.

I expected to have to jump through hoops to get this tv set up with my external antenna and my Amazon Fire TV system but was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was. The picture is excellent and the remote works great even with my fire setup. The only complaint is that there is no easy way to use Bluetooth headphones with the set. It can possibly be done but requires you to purchase an adapter from optical to RCA.If you are looking for a second tv and don't need a headphone connection, this is a good one to look at

Overall I like this TV. One of the 'picture mode' settings did not work correctly, but, since it was one I did not want to use, I kept TV instead of returning it. I did not want to go through the trouble of sending it back and maybe getting one that was worse. TV still has 1 year warrantee I can fall back on if necessary.

reviewTitle: 3 months now the sound isn’t working
reviewDescription: I was a huge fan of this TV despite some of the reviews. I didn’t mind that it isn’t Wi-Fi or Bluetooth able. And I was going to recommend to a friend because I felt it was responsible priced. However today the sound is completely out and I hope I’m able to return if not total money wasted on what I thought was a good deal. If I can figure out what happened to the sound I’ll revise me review. Buyer beware

reviewTitle: No bolts for the legs of tv
reviewDescription: Thank goodness I had ordered a tv stand in case the legs would not work on top of the dresser the tv has to set on.  The base legs for the tv were in the box, but the screws to attach the legs to the tv were not in the box.  Samsung asked me if I needed the screws and I had to explain that when I buy a new tv, the hardware to put the legs on is a vital component.  In 7-10 days I should have the screws for the original legs for the tv.  Any tv is useless without being able to get it to stand upright!  :(

First thing I noticed is how horrible the remote is. I should have read more reviews because many reviewers stated the same thing.I can get over that because this tv was going in my bathroom so I won’t be using it nearly as much as the others. What I can overlook is the fact that there aren’t any holes to mount the TV. One reviewer said that there is a certain Samsung mount that can be used but I didn’t see anything that made me thing mounting is an option. In this day and age, no tv should ever not be able to be mounted.As to the picture quality I have no clue because I’m sending it back because it has to be mounted for my particular use.

reviewTitle: Decent TV.  Remote is hard to use.
reviewDescription: I purchased this unit due to the tight dimensions I had to work with.Overall the picture and sound are good and the streaming Samsung TV channels are a nice plus at no cost.The remote is very difficult to use and the buttons are very small.  About to abandon all the features and plug in a Fire Stick with TV controls.

All of a sudden the sound is muffled on the TV. I turned it off and then turned it back on. It seems to be working better now. Anyone else ever have this problem. Annoying and we just got it! If this happens again it’s getting a ticket straight back to where it came from.
Great tv for first 3 months but then the sound is just horribly muffled.  No reset or anything corrected it.

reviewTitle: does not work with Alexa - it's a 2015 model!
reviewDescription: This is a 2015 model, according to Samsung, not 2019 as Amazon falsely claims.  As a result it doesn't work with Alexa.  Amazon shouldn't be selling 7-year-old TVs without telling customers that.Image is good, sound is OK, so I gave it 2 stars.

Bought this while we were having our kitchen remodeled.  Didn't actually take it out of the box until almost 2 months after Purchase.  Less than a year of it being up, it has stopped powering on, or showing any sign of life.  Have no way of contacting g seller since I'm past the support window from Amazon, so I'll have to go through samsung direct, but I doubt I'll get anywhere

reviewTitle: Misleading answers wit this TV being compatible with Peacock.
reviewDescription: I ask a amazon question asking if this TV could get the new tv streaming app peacock? I got 3 answers from Amazon customers or salesman saying yes it does. However, when I received the tv and tried to search and add the app. I didn't see it and also, did my own research and saw that Samsung TV are not compatible with Peacock. I am very disappointed in the answers I got, and the fact that they were wrong is very misleading. So, I don't know who really answers those questions, but I hope this doesn't happen again.
It does not have Bluetooth capabilities.

reviewTitle: Okay, but with a few issues
reviewDescription: TV for the most part is decent enough.  I only bought it a month ago and I notice that black colors can appear blotchy.  Not sure if that's a streaming quality thing or the TV itself.  I have a good connection and many streaming apps and some places it happens and others it does not.

reviewTitle: PITA to setup with just ethernet
reviewDescription: You have to add an app to your phone to even setup the TV if you are just using ethernet. Then there's account to set up codes flying to your email and another phone for some reason. Just a mess setting up. Big giant turnoff. Never had to use an app or any of this crazy crap for older smart tvs. They must want to sponge up all kinds of info.  First day so I won't comment on how well everything else is. I was about to throw this thing out the window and buy a vizio.
color is NOT good at all

So dissapointed 😞 we've had this TV just under a year and the sound ocassionally goes in and out! Our last samsung lasted an incredible 15 yrs no issues. Not what I'd expect from.a.samsung product. Unfortunate.
The remote is awful, and power cannot be controlled by HDMI devices (Roku etc), the Samsung Smart TV functionality is absolutely horrible, slow and frustrating, so Roku is a must

First, this tv doesn't have the most basic apps like VH1 and MTV. I am sure there are more but those are the two that I quickly noticed.Second, this tv feels like a first generation smart tv. The remote is slow to respond and the different features, settings, etc. are not easily located. Point is, the tv's features are very clunky.Third, the remote is not great. Only because its buttons are not placed in a user friendly way.Fourth, to get quality sound, you have to go to about 40 or 50. That's unfortunate because the tv's last sound interval is 100.I wish this tv was more plug and play, but I've had it for a week and I'm still trying to get used to where things are, its speed (lack thereof) etc. Thankfully, I still have my Roku Stick that I can plug into once I've had enough of trying to figure it out.

This tv is ok.. but it has its issues.. one being.. it drops the volume.. nothing no volume.. I have to shut it down reboot my cable box.. turn everything back on to get volume.  I would rate it a 5 out of 10.
Tried attaching 2 different soundbars; TV doesn't support bluetooth, and neither optical nor HDMI ARC worked with either soundbar.  Built-in speakers are all you get.

Unfortunately, I have received this TV broken - the screen was severely damaged, and I had to return it. Ordered a replacement from Walmart, which arrived in 2 days with free shipping! Overall, its a good TV with a very decent picture and sound quality for a small set. Also, it is one of the better TVs of this size, and it is very easy to mount in a small space. However, there a few things to consider before buying it. First, it appears to be overpriced. For $40 more you can buy a 50-inch Samsung smart TV, 6-series, which is much better then this one in every possible way. Second, the speakers are relatively loud, but the sound is a little distorted - somewhat metallic and unpleasant. Third, the picture is very bright, but the colors and contrast are not quite realistic. Perhaps the greatest disappointment is a not so smart (and somewhat irritating) "smart" component. Whereas the TV comes with preloaded applications, the setup is not user friendly, and Samsung does allow for any meaningful customization. Moving from one application to the next, changing channels and viewing guides is much more difficult compared with streaming devices, such as Roku. Also, there are almost no additional applications, which can be downloaded from the Samsung store. I have another (older) Samsung TV, which works much better for streaming Internet content than this one (with a Roku streaming stick, which can be purchased for $30-45). One advantageous feature is an inbuilt browser. However, it's is hardly usable without a keyboard and mouse.

TV was a little smaller than expected. I should have ordered the 37” model. Setup was not that easy. You can either do it from the tv or using their app. I tried both. Connecting to the internet was fine. The setup process was a little annoying but I finished registering all apps in about 20 minutes.The sound is a little low, but it’s a small TV.Don’t get me started on the remote. I’ve seen better ones at the Dollar store. (See pic) The buttons are ridiculously close together so you are going to push the wrong ones. A real pain during the initial setup process. And I’m sure I will cuss when trying to change the channels at night in my bedroom. I will look for a replacement later.I have this TV connected to my Media Server which by the way was a pain to connect. There is no menu on the TV to do this. I had to go to my server, and force a video (casting) to play on it before the TV finally gave me an option to allow the menu to be pinned to the home page. I did not have any of these problems with my Samsung 55” tv I bought several years ago. I guess you get what you pay for.
I turned it on, went into the next room, heard a series of crackling then a loud pop and some smoke out of the back of the TV and now it's dead. Thirteen months - Awesome :(

reviewTitle: SERIOUSLY!!!! DO NOT BUY THIS AWFUL TV!!!
reviewDescription: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!! I WISH WE COULD RETURN THIS GARBAGE!!!! We bought this TV to replace our 10 year old Roku. Our Roku works better than this awful TV... There’s not much to say about the smart features (except that they’re incredibly annoying), but for some reason, Hulu works just fine but Netflix, Prime, Plex, and Disney Plus all constantly get stuck buffering or the sound just cuts out out of no where. You’re forced to constantly back out of the video and replay it (literally almost every 30 seconds) because it never stops buffering/sound never comes back unless you force it to stop and restart. If you search the issue, it’ll just blame your connection. We’ve trouble shot our internet and have no issues with our connection. Our Roku still plays all streaming sites with ease. Only the occasional buffering. Picture quality is nice but I’d rather less picture quality if it meant I could actually watch my shows all the way through without issues. Long story short - we should’ve gone with another Roku. Buy yourself a Roku.... I wish I listened to the negative reviews on this but we were too excited for a “smart TV” and now we’re stuck with a $200 piece of garbage. Currently have it sitting in storage.... what a waste of money
TV doesn't work properly
Sold as a brand new 2019 model. Totally defective. Sent back to Amazon for refund.They have honored their return terms.Amazon has always been so very fair with me

I absolutely hate this TV. I wanted an inexpensive smart TV with a smaller screen. Before I bought this, I had a Samsung with a FireStick. The screen graphics for apps were easy to see. The ones on this TV are pretty small, and difficult to read. I’ve yet to be able to get it to mirror what’s on my computer, although I’ve been through a dozen YouTube videos.Beware that if you buy this it’s a 2018 model—so it’s already five years old. When I called Samsung for help, they didn’t believe I’d just bought it.Don’t buy this model.

reviewTitle: YOU TUBE TV APP does not work well on this TV
reviewDescription: If you use the YOU TUBE TV APP Do Not Purchase this TV!  The software on this TV does not properly operate this App.  At its best, there is a 15-20 second delay between selecting something on YT TV and the app responding.  Often, once the YT TV selection is made, the buffering circle goes round and round then the screen goes black.  It dies.  This is a known problem specific to this model TV.  (Per both Samsung and You Tube TV.)  Then you have to spend about 10 minutes "refreshing" the tv in order for it to work at all with You Tube TV.  After months of agonizing frustration, I finally swapped this tv (that was in my bedroom) with one I had in my kitchen (that I rarely use).  I highly recommend NOT purchasing this product!!

Had TV for a little over 30 days and picture quality went bad. Would not recommend anyone waste their hard-earned money on this TV. Picture quality is so bad it makes it difficult to even run diagnostics on what the possible problem may be. I will be buying my TV's from Walmart from now on. At least you can take them back when they don't work.

All the reviews of this TV not connecting to the internet are true. This TV is the worst one I’ve ever owned. You reset and reset and reset and occasionally, it connects. This is the perfect TV for someone who wants to reduce their screen time because it rarely works.ETA: the screen broke even though it was barely used and Samsung had to come replace it. Thankfully it was under warranty because it has been less than a year. It took three weeks to get it fixed. Do. Not. Buy.

reviewTitle: This is a really crappy TV.
reviewDescription: The color is awful.  Overpowering and unnatural sapphire blue, electric green, and bright red make an obnoxious color palate.  The audio speakers are incredibly cheap, heavy on the bass to the point of being painful.  The TV initialization process does not work and cannot be removed (asks to be initialized when TV is turned on, then periodically after that).  Samsung customer service is unable to fix the problem.This is the quality of TV you find in a really cheap motel.  This is a crappy TV.(Additional review comment after six months of use.  This thing is a lemon.  In addition to the problems listed above, I think this model TV has some serious and fundamental software problems.)The first opportunity I get, I will throw this one away and buy a new one from a reputable electronics company.Will never buy another Samsung product again.

This is a smart tv, but it’s not Roku compatible. In order to use streaming services, you have to laboriously create an intrusive Samsung account and sign in individually to each service. Because I can’t send it back, I may pass it along to someone who doesn’t have Roku.UPDATE 6/30/23 Sound is now gone. This tv is garbage.Update: after setting up all my streaming services, over half the time I get the Function is Unavailable at this time message. Worst TV I’ve ever owned. Skip.

I bought 2 tvs. Only the 2nd time I purchased a TV new and 1 its a 2019...supposed to be smart and Google and alexa capable.  They DONT TELL YOU that you need an echo dot to do that and then remote has no voice microphone! It socks clucking back and firth between Samsung TV programs and firestick.  Entire point was not to have firestick.  My other TV a Funai, wasn't smart it needed the firestick.  I buy a TV that's over $500 for 2 of them and they need a firestick? Or an echo dot? NO WAY! I've heard Samsung  Tvs are top notch, in my opinion I'd been better off with a Phillips. ONN. or Amazon or an off brand that was new and has those features  built in. Oh and don't bother with Samsungs customer service....lol! They're useless.Im not happy. I think I may return them.

reviewTitle: TV good.  Amazon Good.  Samsung customer support not so much.
reviewDescription: I went with Samsung because I felt it was a good brand.  I payed about $65 more than cheaper comparible modes.TV arrived missing the 4 screws require to mount the feet.1) Called Samsung's 1800 number (twice)  Both times they told me I needed to photograph my screen and fax/sms the Amazon invoice.  I lack that capacity w/ the phone I have.  They had already asked me for email and suggested I screen shot the invoice and send it via attachment (apparently they lack that capacity).  Both agents confirmed that even if I were able to send the invoice as requested I would still wait 10-20 days for 4 screws (took 5 days for the TV to arrive).I gave up... contacted amazon and they save the day by facilitating a exchange.Thanks Amazon.Never again Samsung.
I am extremely disappointed in this tv I have purchased Samsung for about a decade. The software is clumsy the remote is a piece of trash.  Do not buy this tv. At the very least upgrade the remote

reviewTitle: Sound is terrible; switching apps is slow
reviewDescription: You have to create a a Samsung account to work this TV.  Switching apps is a pain, the TV seems to fight it. The sound I have to turn up really high to hear it. My last Samsung TV I could hear at 9. This one I have to put up into the 30s before I can hear it clearly.

I'm very disappointed in this Samsung TV.  I have a Samsung 55" smart TV in my living room and I love it.  I wanted to duplicate the experience in my bedroom, with a smaller version.  I had expected this 32" TV to be similar to the 55", only smaller; unfortunately, it does not function nearly as well.As a basic TV, the UN32N5300AFXZA is fine.  Its picture and audio are decent for the price.  That's about all that's good.  The remote control is one of those old remotes with too many small buttons that have no use, making it awkward to use.  The smart functions on this TV are terrible.  The OS seems to be an older version and will not update.  The apps are also older versions than what I have on the 55" TV and, likewise, cannot update them.  The basic set up for the TV's system refuses to work.  Every time I start the TV, it prompts me to run the set up.  No matter how many times I do that, it makes me do it again.I ended up connecting a Roku device to the TV which works better, but defeats the point of buying the TV in the first place.

reviewTitle: Performed factory reset which resolved sound quality issue.
reviewDescription: I have bought tens of thousands of dollars worth of products from Amazon.  I was experiencing sound quality and the tv just going to black screen when trying to resume a program or when attempting to switch to a new live broadcast.  Finally I performed a factory reset and problems resolved at this time.  This unit has been installed about two months and I hope I don’t have to reset again.  It and another Samsung smart tv is installed on home network with 500Mbps optical service.

reviewTitle: poor picture, dark,...low app availabilty...no blue tooth for audio
reviewDescription: audio is TV, optical and thats it.  Apps are non-existant, closed system. Difficult to use as a smart TV and poor pix.

I got a Samsung because my main big screen TV is a Samsung and I haven’t had 1 issue with it in 15 years and it’s still going strong.I bought the 32 inch for my room and I returned it because I couldn’t stand the user interface and remote.I gave myself 2 weeks to give it a chance and I ended up replacing it with a LG 43”. I was able to get a bigger screen due to the price difference between Samsung and LG. I instantly loved the LG remote, melts right in your hand and the user interface was easy with NO learning curve. I’m glad I returned the Samsung

reviewTitle: Worst sounding TV I have ever heard!
reviewDescription: What a fantastic picture! Worst sounding TV I've ever heard in my 60 years of life. The Audio is so bad, it's like an AM radio except worse. How can Samsung put a product like this on the market? Is it to promote having to purchase a sound bar? Remember if you have to purchase a sound bar, make sure you buy all the extra cables and you'll also have an extra remote sitting on the table. I returned my purchase of this horrible sounding TV the very next day! Also, out of curiosity, I looked up 75 inch QLED Samsung TV and read reviews that had similar sound issues.

reviewTitle: Cheap but hard to set up
reviewDescription: When it came it had no memory left to download the apps I wanted and you CANNOT delete the apps that come with it.  What a fiasco!!!

First of all, it was a nightmare setting up the two little legs that they give you to hold the TV up right. And even though I did everything according to the directions, it still wasn't the steadiest. It also sits a lot lower than the average TV in my entertainment center, but that's not too big a deal. Then I tried to set the TV up I was hitting in my Wi-Fi password. I have a capital letter in my password and there was no way to make the letters capital on the little screen where you have to move around to the different letters. I ended up having to go in and change my Wi-Fi password so that I could type it in with no capitals. And then, it still wouldn't connect. At this point, rather disgruntled and just wanting to have some features for the night, I tried to hook up my fire stick to it, and that's not working. I have never needed an additional cable with any other TV to use my fire stick, just what comes with the fire stick and of course the plug to the TV. But this one is not working. I'm really trying to figure out how to return this. So disappointing!

reviewTitle: Constantly drops channels, sometimes blasts volume 3x max level
reviewDescription: Channels keep disappearing from the list, only solution is to rescan. Rescan means setting up all lists again. Have had to rescan over a dozen times this month alone, sometimes more than once a day. Scan is inconsistent as well, sometimes only finds less than half the channels. Should find 98, has come in as low as 47. Just have to keep rescanning until it decides to find them all.A couple times I've turned the set on and the volume is blasting at about 3 times the normal max level. Only solution is to keep turning off and on until it returns to normal.Very disappointed with this set.

After 36 hours of working like a normal tv an error icon appeared on the screen that looked like a flashdrive being plugged into a USB port. All other functions other than turning the tv off and on stopped working. Samsung costumer care had no idea how to fix the issue. They told me to download software from their website, put it on a flashdrive (expecting everyone just to have flash drives lying around in 2023), and then plug it into the tv. This, of course, did not work after I tried this all for a brand new TV. Highly recommend not wasting your time with this model.

reviewTitle: For a Samsung tv, this is the worst
reviewDescription: First of all, the sound quality is terrible, squeaky at best and difficult to hear. I purchased it for my bedroom. The analog audio extension does not work at all. I had to order a Prozor digital to analog converter from amazon to use on the digital audio ( optical ) to enable my TV listener device. It works, but again very low volume. I have tried the sound adjustments, but nothing increases the volume and sound quality. The TV remote is to small and difficult to use.I would send back, but I live in Freeport, Bahamas, and after paying import duty and courier fee from Davie, Fla etc. its a loss for me all around.I will be very hesitant to purchase another Samsung TV. I have a 10 year old Samsung 47" in my TV room which I am very pleased with.I WANT MY MONEY BACK!!!! so I can buy a decent TV.

This was a frustrating experience. I had bought another Samsung that was a 43 inch and it seems to be working well so I tried to 30 inch for my bedroom. The TV worked OK for about three days. Then one morning I turned it on, and the volume was extremely loud. I turned the volume down to 1 and it was still loud, and the audio is muted, hard to understand. And I agree with other reviews that they the feet are cheaply made. Also, it skips around apps and comes on with whatever app it chooses and then it’s hard to change it. The remote control has tiny buttons. It’s hard to navigate with this remote and hard to stay on the apps that I want. The TV doesn’t seem to like finding YouTube TV so I have to struggle with it.

reviewTitle: Worst TV I've ever owned - I am done with Samsung
reviewDescription: Sound issues from day 1. When I turn the TV on, there is never any sound from the connected uverse DVR. To fix this, you have to press the TV source button and cycle through all sources only to return to the original uverse source and then, amazing! there is sound! Also, from time to time the speakers emit a piercing screeching sound, no matter how the volume level is set.After also having a bad experience with a Samsung refrigerator, I am done with Samsung products. Buyer beware.

Good points (pretty picture) bad points,the interface is slower and more difficult to maneuver. 3.the insistence that samsung has for involving their app in other producers products -way too many adds. It seems really greedy on their part. I contend that it is not Samsungs business to use their customers in this way!4. Over engineered features that I don't know who asked for.5 bad,incomplete manuals.  So, I will be returning this bad TV I don't need this frustration.  Almost forgot - the remote control mall goofy with the buttons being moved for no apparent reasons. I will not be buying any Samsung products ever again...  Thanks,from a very annoyed customer....
Ordered tv no mounting screws for legs. Returned replacement the same. Don’t buy

reviewTitle: You can not turn off live tv!!
reviewDescription: Do you hate getting to choose what you watch? If so, this is the TV for you! I am flabbergasted that Samsung made something so horrible! The search function is inoperable, it takes at least 90 seconds just for an app to open, they hide your apps and Force live tubi tv down your throat! You cannot turn off live TV, despite a programmer in the family and tons of videos and tech support we still can't turn off live TV. The 80's tvs with barely any channel options, poor reception and no ability to pause were much better than this TV! I hope to save someone from making a terrible mistake as I did. I will burn this in the yard as soon as I can afford to get anything else.

reviewTitle: It was great until it wasn't
reviewDescription: TV died right at 1.5 years since purchase. So disappointed!

reviewTitle: Not a fan of this TV
reviewDescription: I purchased this TV to replace a non-smart LG TV. I shouldn’t have! I have no issues with my streaming service on my other TVs but this one goes in and out. Will be putting this TV in a room where it will rarely be used.

reviewTitle: Scammed my mom as soon as she turned it on.
reviewDescription: There’s all these activation QR codes and connectivity phone numbers to call. My 73 year old mom just got scammed on CHRISTMAS bc she called a number on the brand new tv she was just setting up. I don’t understand how a brand new tv is full of scams. Google it. It’s a serious problem. She’s sending the piece of junk back. I couldn’t be any angrier.
screen was broken upon arrival

reviewTitle: Item never worked out of the box.
reviewDescription: The product never worked out of the box. TV would boot up but would not respond to the remote. Rebooted the TV 3 times and rebooted the remote 10 times. Replaced batteries in the remote with 3 different sets of batteries. Nothing. Contacted TCL and was informed there was a 30 minute wait. Finally got a scheduled call back but the connection was terrible. Had them call me back again and still connection issues. Never had a TV not work out of the box. I returned the item.

Within 4 months it just suddenly stopped connecting to the internet. Internet service is fine, but keep getting DNS errors. Samsung told me to factory reset. Less than 2 months later, same problem, now factory reset isn’t available.

Setup went fine. Noticed white lights in the display. Upon further inspection the television was dented on both sides in the back. The frame in the front was also bent back. I returned for a replacement which is now delayed. Reading the reviews for the same time as my order it appears many in this shipment were damaged product. I will probably cancel my replacement and just order it elsewhere.
Do not purchase! I ordered one for my daughter for Christmas and it came damaged. They send me a new one and it stopped turning on after three months. I will never get another tv from Amazon.

reviewTitle: Didn’t even make it 3 Years!!! 1/2 the screen is black.

reviewDescription: My sound just went out and I only had it a year in July
Had the tv 2 months and it has no picture now. Only sound.Buy a better tv

reviewTitle: Speakers blew out after only a few months
reviewDescription: I was happy with the purchase until the speakers blew -- the TV is only a few months old and the sound is distorted - the TV is unwatchable. Going to throw it in the trash and head to Best Buy -- where I should have gone in the first place.

reviewTitle: This is 2018 Model. Had issues in Set up and online setup per enclosed instructions
reviewDescription: In setting up we went to the website per the Samsung set up instructions and somehow ended up being offered a fraudulent lifetime Amazon subscription.  We were able to cancel the payment as it had not cleared and canceled our credit card and changed our Amazon password out of an abundance of caution.  This potential fraud was very slick and well orchestrated as we only followed the instructions provided

Used this TV as a security system monitor. Lasted 2 year almost to the day. Now will not turn on. I've had cheaper TV's last longer, much longer, than this. The smart tv features are middle of the road 2018 type stuff, not responsive, slow navigation. Picture quality is actually really good. Remote if you have the older one isn't crippled with services buttons and has navigations for sleep, guide, info etc.At this point - there are 2021 and 2022 versions of tvs that make this one look like the 2018 tv that it is.....
I own a business, I ordered this tv a couple of months back and had it stored waiting to be put up. I open the box and this is what I get.

Thank you Samsung for totally ruining Christmas. This company is too cheap to make a proper base so it’s impossible to get the stubby little screws into the beyond cheap, dark and shoddy plastic holes so the tv won’t stand up. I was super excited to set this TV up for Christmas and watch some shows with the family but no as Samsung couldn’t spend 3 more cents on metal screw holes so an hour of Xmas wasted wrestling with the cheap legs and TV has to be returned. Samsung you are dead to me.

reviewTitle: Sound quality is bad after 2 months.
reviewDescription: TV worked fine for exactly 2 months. Sound wasn’t perfect but it worked. Then one time I turned it on and the volume shot up to 50 and was extremely muffled from that point on. To the point, you cannot understand. Luckily I had a ‘sound box’ which I now use 100% .... The picture quality is good.  The remote works about 90% of the time. (You have to push the button several times) I guess you get what you pay for.  I would not recommend it.

CUSTOMER SERVICE IS THE WORST. THEY ARE LOOKING TO THEIR BENEFIT AND NOT THE CUSTOMERS. MY TV SPARKED WITH A BURNING SMELL AND THEY WANT ME TO SEND IT IN FOR SERVICE. MAYBE A FIRE. THEY DONT CARE. I ONLY HAVE IT FOR 2 MONTHS.
Very disappointed. Nothing but plastic. Poor directions. Had five people trying to program the remote including the cable man. I gave up trying to watch tv.MAOB.

reviewTitle: Screen looks cracked, remote does not work
reviewDescription: Major dislike, wish I could have withheld one star.Set up is horrible, instructions show a completely different remote, screen looks cracked and 'spidering' all over. Delivery driver likely chucked it on my porch, thus, the damage.Returning for 100% refund.

reviewTitle: No analog audio output, and remote only controls volume for the crappy internal speakers
reviewDescription: Disappointed in this product because it doesn't have analog audio output, so I had to buy a DAC to convert digital to analog audio. On top of that, the audio settings don't have an option for fixed vs variable audio output, so I can't use the remote control to adjust volume for my precision studio monitors. The remote only adjusts volume for their crappy internal speakers, and presumably might work with a soundbar, but that's not in the cards for me.The picture is very good, and Samsung is one of the few brands that still offer component video input to support legacy video sources. But if you have legacy audio equipment in your setup, you might be in for a disappointment.
Lasted for only 2 1/2 years and then wouldn't power up.

I purchased this TV in February of this year. It had major problems as of last weekend. I expected more from Samsung. I wasn’t thrilled with it from the beginning but I kept it anyway. The sound is tinny and the picture isn’t that great. I had a 1080 pixel TV for 10 years prior so I was expecting a very similar picture. It wasn’t even close. Bear in mind that this is a 2018 model. Beware. I don’t recommend this TV.

reviewTitle: Terrible TV set and the worst customer support from Samsung
reviewDescription: Purchased this TV for my kitchen. Developed a problem that the TV would not turn on. After checking the remote which was ok the only way to get the TV to turn on would be to unplug and re-plug the power after 5 minutes. This is very difficult as the TV is wall-mounted and the plug is behind the TV. I returned the TV for a new one and the same problem occurred. I contacted Samsung and for 2 hours worked with a technician to install an upgrade to the firmware. The TV still had this problem. I spoke to Samsung and asked them to send me a different model TV or do something to help me. They have the WORST customer service. They insist that all they can do is have me send the TV back to Samsung and have a technician validate the problem, then they might send me a different TV or replace it with the same model. The customer service supervisor was rude, left me on hold for almost 30 minutes and could care less if she could help me or not. Very poor unprofessional behavior.

I bought this TV to replace a super cheap roku TV that was much too slow to change between channels and this TV takes even longer I stand there for 2 minutes waiting to find the channel on the app I want to play it may be a great gaming TV I have no idea but for actually watching television shows it's the worst
Did not look good, not long enough

reviewTitle: after 3 weeks of installation - sound does not work
reviewDescription: Samsung service is no help.  I purchased the TV on July 12 and installed Aug 6, after 3 weeks of use, sound stopped working.  Amazon says because it is out of return window of 30 days, I will be charged a $49 re-stocking fee.  Samsung and Amazon only stand behind the TV for 30 days?!!
I suppose I should have opened when it arrived but when I finally got to it the screen was cracked and the tv is worthless so buyer beware check it out right away

This tv is not good - has poor quality picture, no bluetooth, and the cord doesn't stay plugged into the tv. It just falls out sometimes and you have to turn it off, plug it back in and start over again. I regret having bought this tv. This is after having it for less than a year.
This unit is 2019 model.  Does not update via wifi. Absolutely a pain and not worth it.  Make sure you get a flash drive.  Necessary for the update. Smh!
being blind this tv is worthless. my old tv has audio description...very out of date for todays standards

Ok so the TV gave me issues with connecting Alexa, I was never able to get it connected so I just ignored it and was just like we don't need the Alexa. Then I did an update on its own and now it won't turn on AT ALL. I was offered no help getting it fixed or returned. Just an all around terrible experience purchasing this TV.
Remote does not work, screen is not that great. I just kept my old Samsung screen.

reviewTitle: TV DOES NOT WORK AFTER 2 WEEKS
reviewDescription: THIS TV DOES NOT WORK AFTER 2 WEEKS OF USAGE

I bought this TV to use for streaming. It's connected to the Internet like all my other devices. But it will not stream or play anything through the Internet. No Prime, Amazon!!! No Netflix. No ESPN. No PEACOCK --- none of the apps I pay for will play through this POS TV. Don't buy it!!!!!
Purchased 3 of these.  2 out of the 3 I had to return due to screen damage.  Lines through the screen.

We had this tv in our guest room. It barely gets any use. After about 10 or so uses, I tuned it on and the speaker is blown. It’s being used in a very small room, the volume has never been very high. Incredibly disappointed.
Sound distorted within a month. Samsung not responsive to resolve issue

reviewTitle: Don’t do it; just don’t. Bad idea
reviewDescription: Don’t waste your money. It’s a crappy deal. Tv fights you when you try to turn it off. Samsung plus is literally attacking you, it never stops…holiday movie y’all . The controller is the worst. And I got a 65 Samsung upstairs. Never again.  Sony or LG. Sham of a product.

I was so looking forward to receiving this TV, I received it today and after putting the feet on the TV and the batteries in the remote, I turned the TV on and there were so many cracks in the screen it was ridiculous. It looks as though this TV was thrown from one end of the warehouse to the other end. Sending back.
seems to be working fine.  tonight, lost the volume issue with the speaker. tried troubleshooting tried to reset. still speaker distorted.will need to replace this unit.

This Smart tv has some great features & beautiful picture. I only gave it 3 stars because the sound has cut out or blasted several times in a month on 2 of these purchased, don't know how to correct it!

This TV has a lot of great features and the video is wonderful, but I keep having off and on audio problems. Some days the audio is very loud and distorted and I can’t do anything to change audio levels and other times I can’t raise the audio. It’s usually fixed by turning the set off and on a few times but I shouldn’t have to do that.

In December 2022, we bought SAMSUNG 40-inch Class LED Smart FHD TV 1080P (UN40N5200AFXZA, 2019 Model). We didn't get to open the box until today, February, 07. We found there was no remote control. Please help.

reviewTitle: A little disappointed in the picture quality and no light on the remote.
reviewDescription: Picture seems to fade to dark.  Why is that?

I was hoping for better picture quality but it's lacking in that area. I have cable TV so the remote must be paired with the cable supplied remote. For the price I paid, it was not worth going for a name brand. I have a 23 inch off brand non-smart TV and the picture quality is superb.  I wanted a larger screen, so went with a Samsung.
I just thought all new tv''s had bluetooth..I didn't even check that out.  I would not have gotten this tv if I had realized that there was no bluetooth.  Hope this helps.
Was good until stopped working but maybe it wasn't supposed to last longer than 2 years 🤷🏽‍♀️
Color is not as good as expected in spite I tried any of available options to make it better.

the tv was locked ,would not operate unless i signed up for a samsung account , was held hostageif i had known that , i would  bought another brand , there was no good picture of the back of the tv ,some in and out connections are on the left  side back , be careful of the wall mountpicture and such are good

I wrote a review awhile back explaining the problems I was having with my first Samsung 32” inch that was returned and now I’m writing this review about the one that replaced it. It has the same exact problems! Sometimes the tv won’t turn on until you pull the plug for a few seconds then plug it back in, sometimes it turns on with distorted sound so pull the plug to fix that and sometimes the sound to picture timing is off. I’m not an expert when it comes to electronics but, I believe most of the issues are caused by the smart  part of the tv. It acts like a computer that is busy doing something or has jammed up due to lack of computing power. I’m hoping that Samsung will come out with a software update that will fix this problem but, if they don’t do something soon I can see this losing lots of customers for them. Every tv in my house is a Samsung and I’ll be looking elsewhere in the future. I will say that when it works, it’s got a great picture but so do other tv out there today.

These tvs are junk 1st one came broken screen so ordered a replacment second one came no sound at all o.k. will just thinking I got a dud I sent back tryed 1 more time this one lasted a little over 3 weeks and now nothing no matter what we tryed nothing so was going to send back guess what missed the 30 day window by 2 days so i will not be ordereing any more of these for sure

The first TV delivered had a crack screen, the second one delivered worked for 2 hours and stopped for s firmware update. Called Samsung who told me to get a USB and download the firmware. This didn’t work, TV won’t respond to remote to get to settings! Absolute nightmare!

reviewTitle: Research before purchasing this model to save yourself time and money.
reviewDescription: This model was apparently built with a faulty power supply according to the many customers on this and other sites that have complained about not being able to get the unit to power up.  After purchasing 2 of these a year apart, I m done with Samsung Televisions.  If you check websites that customers have submitted reviews that are not blocked by Amazon or Samsung, you will discover several pages of users who bought this model which failed and will not turn on.  All the troubleshooting steps recommended fail and the unit becomes trash, unless the customer spent extra money to purchase a warranty.  I believe Samsung is aware of this inferior model but they still sell it to customers who can't afford or don't want to pay their inflated prices for larger more expensive units.If you have a unit that works properly after a year, consider yourself luckier that those of us who have wasted our money.  I believe Amazon should further investigate this product to protect it's members.  Since they do not without the extra expense of a warranty,  we will discontinue purchasing larger electronic products from them.

reviewTitle: The unit I got was not new and was defective
reviewDescription: Unit was sold as new but was not, Samsung confirmed that it had been registered previously at least once. It was defective also, which is likely why previous owners returned it. Sometimes TV's response to remote input was normal, sometimes delayed 5-10 seconds and sometimes just would not respond at all. Clearly a defective unit that was recycled as new. Picture quality was fair, not as good as advertised or as good as an old HD TV I bought in 2009 although no idea if that was this defective unit only or applies to all units of this model. Anyway, returned it and am too scared to try another one. Will but something else, probably not a Samsung as my experience with a couple other Samsung TV's has not been good either.

The tv picture was suddenly compromised by a series of vertical lines. Tried contacting Samsung using the number on this site. Was passed around with no resolution. This was not Amazon’s fault. The Samsung response was worse than useless. Avoid at all costs!!!

The first unit worked perfectly for 2 days then could only get a black screen including HDMI ports and Roku stick. Usual fixes did not work. Would not display Roku on HDMI either.
