The power button turned it on and off and ready light indicated the remote was sending a signal. Sent the first one back but same thing happened to second one. Called Samung and they had no solutions since factory reset requires being able to see screen.  Prior TV was an older Samsung that it replaced worked fine at same location. I am sending it back and ordering an LG.  Have to assume there is a fatal floor in the electronics.

We bought this TV for my husband's office. Not a week after purchase, the TV died. We contacted Samsung and they couldn't even tell us what was wrong. Had to purchase a box and wrapping to return it. And what's worse is that the refund has taken forever. Today it will be 10 days and still no refund. The item was returned on November 11th, received on November 15th, and still no refund back on our debit card. Ironically, Amazon charges my debit card immediately, but it sure doesn't process a refund that quickly. The entire transaction was a HUGE disappointment.

I made a mistake buying this tv.  The picture on my 10 year old Samsung was better.  I cannot bring out the details in the shadows, it's too bright, and the off angle view is terrible.  I've watched calibration videos and tried everything and it still sucks.  I bought this because a review said it was one of the best 40 inch tv's and it had a center stand.  Well the picture was from a 2017 model and it did not have a center stand.  So don't believe those reviews, they're probably written by an employee of the manufacturer which suspected, but what else do you have to go by.  They got their sale.
The sound goes super loud.  Then it can be just a buzzz and other times just no sound.  I have changed remotes contacted cable company  The only fix is to unplug then reply it.  Don’t buy

Good pic and sound. A great value. My only complaint is the remote isn't back-lit and hard to use in a darkened room. Ans Samsung menu and interface in general is clumsy but I'm already into the Samsung ecosystem up to my neck so I live with it.

i like most everything about this tv except for the too highly reflected nature of the screen. i have a laptop - mac retina - that has a great coating that kills most of the reflection. that should be required for TVs!the other thing is some sort of quick navigation tool i guess is the best way to describe it at the bottom of the screen that is really annoying. i haven't figured out how to get rid of it reliably.navigation is one of those things that i'll choose what i want to see. i don't need 1/3 of the screen filled with little suggestion pictures.

Bought two of these 3 months ago and couldn't be happier. 32 inch size perfect for small room and bedroom. Color fabulous. Sound is fine and in one room was even able to connect it to my old receive stereo speakers through the optic audio connector. The Smart tv function works fine through wireless internet connection although screen choices still a bit confusing. The Remote tabs for fast forward /pause a bit small. Shopped around and Amazon price the best at that time.Update atfter 15 months with significant usage. Still terrific. Only problem occasionally HBO freezes requiring a re-start of HBO. Otherwise couldn't be happier

The remote doesn't work and I'm having a hard time getting another one I've sent the serial number in a few times and they keep saying they need the serial number if this keeps up I will never buy samsung again

Picture quality is wonderful. The auto-ambient light feature is amazing. Never have to worry about glare due to the angle of the sun/time of day. Extremely light weight. Setup was easy and straight forward. I am not thrilled with the remote/ease of use. I stream only, so expected getting to Netfix and Amazon Prime would be easy-peasy one click, but it takes a number of clicks of buttons and navigation arrows to get to the apps. The remote does not have a back light which is frustrating. imho, not particularly user friendly.  Also was disappointed there is no headphone input or bluetooth to use an external portable speaker.Overall, excellent picture quality at a very good price. The wifi connection has been dependable (no dropped connection so far) Remote is pretty bad.

reviewTitle: You Get What You Pay For
reviewDescription: Obviously not top-of-the-line, but does a fine job at its price point.  I don't know how well the "smart" portion works, though, because I literally just stuck a Roku in it after performing the setup.

reviewTitle: Great it you want an older Smart Tv
reviewDescription: Make sure you buy a 2019 or 2020 I was actually lucky Amazon did the right thing but I got stuck with an older Tv . Which I ended giving away. Make sure is compatible with your cable company by asking Samsung. Or just a 2022 overall Samsung is always there to help.

it sucks setting it up ,the password section likes to omit letters or numbers  .put password for internet in so many times my tower has to be reset  .had my so put his in so could watch regular tv.i will reset my tower latter

I just installed this TV and it works pretty well but I have not used all the features yet.  The one thing that was mentioned in other reviews was that sometime the TV will not turn on.  This happened to me once so far.  I followed what "support" said and unplugged it and then plugged it back in.  It worked!  I have not had the problem again, so far.  There is a "bug" in their software some place.  FIX IT SAMSUNG!  I bought this because of your reputation.  Right now I am going to use a power strip that has some "hot" outlets so I do not have to turn off the other components to "fix" this problem.  Come on Samsung, fix this problem.

Long story, but I needed to replace a very old 32" Samsung. I used my Amex points to get this particular tv. It's slightly bigger than that 32" antique. It does the job and it's a smart tv. Firestick is installed. Can't really complain. Fyi, this is not my main tv.
The picture is awful. No matter how much I try to adjust it, the picture doesn't get any better.

reviewTitle: Unit does NOT have Alexa built in and was my only reason to buy it
reviewDescription: Very disappointed with this being a Samsung. Remote does not work smoothly as input jumps all over even with a clear view to the tv. I expected much better from Samsung. Wish I could return it but already got rid of the box….

reviewTitle: Disconnects constantly. Brand new. Lasted 3 months
reviewDescription: Disconnects from Wi-Fi and app - it’s brand new. So frustrating. Won’t work without Ethernet Connection and older model did. Terrible remote. Do not recommend Samsung anymore.I’d do anything to return this before throwing it and it’s useless remote out the window. No joke. My second tv I purchased for half the price and twice the size is beyond better and I had an older model if this Samsung I loved. I got a lemon and Samsung really downgraded! It’s an expensive iPod. Quit working after 3 months. Shameful.Customer service is even worse than their shameful produces.

This was a case of " to good to be true".  As advertised "NEW" 2019 Samsung $275.  So I ordered.  The arrival and install went well.  Then when turned on we noticed there was a light across top of picture.  The frame across the top was loose.  Installer said it should be returned.  Return went well and I reordered the same item.  When 2nd  arrived I scheduled the install.  Opened box "which had no damage".  Set TV on table and plugged in. badly damaged.  Looked like it had been ice skated on.  Very upset needless to say.  2nd time was not a charm.  Have reordered but a 2021 and no Samsung.  More money and hope a adjustment can be made toward new purchase.

Bought this TV because it mentioned it had the Xfinity app. Wish I had known that it does NOT have it before I went through the complicated and tedious set up process, only to find it didn’t come with it. Very difficult to get answers if it was possible, and I finally found out (thanks to best buy reviews) that they no longer carry the app on this model. Pretty redic you can’t download it. I got a LG instead, much better tv, bigger screen, 4K, only $10 more and easy to download and use the app. Samsung is going down the tubes!

Don't buy this TV, despite saying on the website, on the TV box and in the instructions, this TV is NOT compatible with Alexa. I spent 7 hours with 5 Samsung support reps over 4 days trying to get this figured out and at the end of the day they admitted is was false product labeling. You need to have Samsung's own smarthings app built into the TV to get Alexa to run - which this model isn't capable of. Yes, their own current TV isn't able to run thier own apps!

Samsung smart tv, here's a screen shot.  This happens about every 35 minutes when  using wifi. This has doing it on Samsung tv my 2nd one junk.I can use other brands of smart tv no problems,  it's Samsung tv. Junk...
Started glitching when i put the tv on. This tv will disappoint you.

A gentle bump to the table this tv was on sent the screen topling over. Luckily I caught it and there was no damage. The other annoyance is that every time you turn it on it’s programmed to be on a loud commercial channel of some kind instead of a silent, standard menu, like I’ve become used to.Overall, good picture and sound.2022 update: this thing barely functions. Every time you press a button on the remote you have to count several seconds before it reacts. And every time you turn the tv on, it’s on some random public channel at top volume instead of the app you last used. And “Recently Used Apps” are full of things I’ve never heard of, never used before, that Samsung is getting paid to put on that list. I seriously regret buying this tv.

reviewTitle: Don’t buy this model of Samsung TV.
reviewDescription: I have owned other Samsung TV’s and they have been very good. This TV’s sound would periodically go off and the only way to get back was to shut the TV off and then turn it back on. The other problem was at times it would not turn on and the only way to get it to turn on was to unplug the TV, leave it unplugged for a couple of minutes, plug it back in and then it would turn on. When I called their technical department they said it was because the remote needed to be fully discharged by removing the batteries. Who the heck they were talking to an idiot? I think I was talking to one. Remotes do not hold a charge that needs to be discharged. Poor tech help.

6 months later the sound stopped working. This is an entry level tv and I wish I had spent a bit more to have one that would have lasted longer. Customer support was very unhelpful and refused to take it back under warranty.
This TV is incredibly frustrating.  It processes like a 1980 dial up computer. The remote is clunky. I would give negative stars if possible
Too small remote annoying picture nice volume nice Samsung TV plus went out trust me don't buy something wrong with these TV's
Televisions was glitchy the whole time and just went completely out

Product arrived with fracture screen. Samsung wouldn't replace but sold me larger tv, which also arrived with fractured screen.  Moral of story, don't buy tv from Amazon, suspect that shipping company is culprit...

reviewTitle: Don't waste your time or money
reviewDescription: We were looking for an affordable, somewhat basic HD TV and this fit the bill. Less than one month past the 12 month warranty the TV stopped responding to the remote. I spent two hours with support trying to trouble shoot it only for them to say it's needs to be repaired. The repair was quoted to cost the same amount as the TV. Unsatisfactory customer service, I'm never buying a Samsung product again. I'm not sure who they work with on repairs but the person who called me was quite terrible and unhelpful.I suppose that's what we get for buying a cheaper TV, but I expected more from Samsung.

reviewTitle: THIS IS THE WORST TV THAT I EVER OWNED😡
reviewDescription: The TV has a mind of it’s own!  It shuts off or turns on by itself. (That’s if it goes on at all). After months of frustration, I finally believe that there is something wrong with the  “Smart TV”, which I never use, Sometimes the Smart apps come up with a blue screen. NO PICTURE or SOUND. Other times nothing happens at all. If I unplug the TV (which is very difficult for me, I have nerve damage in my back), then wait a minute, and plug it back in it comes on. Then the cycle starts over again the next time I try to put it on. 😡 Many reviewers have the same problems.Many more issues, sound, picture & changes channels. Turns on in the middle of the night. I wanted to return it, but my son-in-law threw the box out when he set it up.
The sound started going after using it twice. Have a larger one that the sound is extremely quiet. Terrible quality

It leads you to believe you have smart tv. All the apps are on the tv but you have to download the samsung app where you have to give it permission to read all your info on the tv and your phone to use any smart features and even then the app is glitchy and you have to go through several steps to use specific  smart features. Instead of a menu in the tv. Deceptive and over reaching. Not only that but the Alexa capability was never on there.  When the arrives it says it's only for higher end models.  Nowhere on the description does it say that.

reviewTitle: TV does not connect to Alexa as advertised
reviewDescription: The quality of the Samsung TV is fine. The problem is connectivity with Alexa. Although the Amazon description and the information on the Samsung Box clearly say that the TV is compatible with Alexa, it is NOT !!After spending more than an hour with Samsung support, where they took remote control of the TV, and told me that they were transferring me to another department to install the necessary app, I was cut-off. When I re-called Samsung they told me that the TV would not work with Alexa because I had the wrong model of Samsung Smartphone. I'm disappointed with both Amazon and Samsung for not specifying that Alexa compatibility was dependent on the type of phone that is used.
